description_html:
JOB SUMMARY

As a State Director, you will oversee day to day CDCN operations within your territory, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and compliance with all Federal and State regulations and Managed Care Organization (MCO) requirements. You will manage intake and referral workflows, payroll and accounts receivable processes, staff training, and service delivery while strengthening program financial performance, promoting a cohesive office environment, and supporting daily operations and client advocacy.

JOB DUTIES

  • Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to support effective service delivery, represent the organization at stakeholder meetings, health fairs, and provider fairs, and direct marketing efforts to referral sources
  • Ensure compliance with all applicable legal requirements, standards, policies, and procedures at the program office level, including directing advanced reporting and overseeing annual reviews of policies, procedures, standard operating procedures, and satisfaction surveys
  • Oversee program performance management, including responsibility for scorecards, dashboards, key performance indicators, deliverables, and timely completion of projects
  • Lead and manage complex service programs, special projects, large-scale enrollments, and transitions, while identifying and implementing process improvement initiatives
  • Demonstrate strong leadership competencies by effectively leading self, others, and the organization through integrity, emotional intelligence, communication, strategic thinking, adaptability, innovation, and results-driven execution
  • Provide clear, professional written and verbal communication, serve as a proficient public speaker, and deliver excellent customer service to internal and external clients
  • Direct recruitment, hiring, training, supervision, and professional development of employees, while participating in and assigning training activities
  • Maintain operational effectiveness through strong problem-solving, decision-making, prioritization, multitasking, dependability, computer proficiency, and coordination of workflows
  • Maintain the financial health of programs by directing payroll, authorization, accounts receivable operations, budgets, service/support plan development, and CRM database accuracy
  • Oversee client enrollment, assessments, supervisory visits, and ongoing service delivery as required
  • Travel within the assigned geographic area as needed
  • Bilingual skills preferred in various locations
  • Perform other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s Degree in related field preferred
  • Bachelor’s degree in the field of Social Work, Psychology, Counseling, Rehabilitation, Nursing, Sociology, or Related Field with one-year experience working with individual(s) with disabilities or the elderly preferred
  • Four (4) years management experience preferred
  • Experience leading a team of 50+ staff
  • Previous experience working in a call center preferred
  • Ability to work flexible and/or extended hours, if needed, to meet the job requirements.

The incumbent typically works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone and other office equipment as needed to perform duties. The noise level in the work environment is typical of that of an office. Incumbent may encounter frequent interruptions throughout the workday. The employee is regularly required to sit, talk, or hear; frequently required to use repetitive hand motion, handle or feel, and to stand, walk, reach, bend or lift up to 20 pounds.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description_html:
JOB SUMMARY

Service Coordinators assist with daily intake and referral processes to set clients up for services, coordinating their in-home care needs in compliance with Federal/State Regulations and Managed Care Organization (MCO) program rules.  They maintain and coordinate a caseload of clients enrolled in Medicaid programs and conduct regular check-ins on clients to update care plans if that client’s needs change.

 

JOB DUTIES

  • Maintain and coordinate a caseload of clients enrolled in Medicaid programs
  • Coordinate clients’ in-home care needs in compliance with Federal/State Regulations, Managed Care Organization (MCO) program rules, and contract requirements
  • Assist with daily intake and referral processes to ensure positive business growth and development
  • Promote cohesiveness in the office environment
  • Support day-to-day operations and client advocacy
  • Ability to meet position requirements with little direct oversight
  • Collaborate with stakeholders regarding the delivery of services
  • Effective written and verbal communicator
  • Comply with applicable legal requirements, standards, policies, and procedures
  • Demonstrate dependability
  • Demonstrate effective problem-solving and decision-making skills
  • Exhibit computer efficiency
  • Handle complex service programs and special projects
  • Market services to referral sources as needed
  • Maintain necessary skills and knowledge to coordinate workflow
  • Participate in professional development and training activities
  • Prioritize and multitask effectively
  • Provide excellent customer service to internal and external clients
  • Represent the company at stakeholder meetings, health fairs, and provider fairs
  • Enroll clients and employees in services, web portal, and EVV systems as needed
  • Conduct necessary client assessments and home visits as required
  • Bilingual preferred in various locations
  • Answer and make phone calls and occasional video calls
  • Other duties as assigned

 

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree in the field of Social Work, Psychology, Counseling, Rehabilitation, Nursing, Sociology or Related Field preferred
  • 1 year of previous experience working with individuals with disabilities or the elderly preferred
  • Combination of education and experience
  • Employees must provide their own reliable internet if working a remote/hybrid position

The incumbent typically works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone and other office equipment as needed to perform duties. The noise level in the work environment is typical of that of an office. Incumbent may encounter frequent interruptions throughout the workday. The employee is regularly required to sit, talk, or hear; frequently required to use repetitive hand motion, handle or feel, and to stand, walk, reach, bend or lift up to 20 pounds.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description_html:
JOB SUMMARY

The Collections Coordinator I is responsible for all inbound and outbound calls and emails from participants, care providers, and other departments regarding account statuses and other inquiries professionally and respectfully. The Collections Coordinator I is responsible for posting payments and payment reconciliation of all payments received for client responsibility, guarantor accounts, and other payments received for monies owed to CDCN. They are responsible for noting all interactions and vital document details.

The schedule for this position is Monday through Friday, 9:00 am to 6:00 pm MST.

JOB DUTIES
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Basic understanding of billing and accounts receivable to complete the steps necessary to resolve issues
  • Notifications for past-due accounts
  • Record notes in the appropriate format
  • Process and reconcile payments daily
  • Sorting daily mail
  • Work directly with participants, case managers, care providers, and program operation staff
  • Answer calls and emails
  • Participate in professional development and training activities
  • Maintain the necessary skills and knowledge to coordinate workflow
  • Prioritize and multitask effectively
  • Demonstrate effective problem-solving and decision-making skills
  • Demonstrate dependability
  • Comply with applicable legal requirements, standards, policies, and procedures
  • Effectively communicate verbally and in writing
  • Provide excellent customer service to internal staff and external participants, care providers, and other parties
  • Exhibit computer efficiency
  • Work with multiple computer systems (CXone, Excel, Office, U2, Solomon, Waystar, SharePoint, and Docuware)

QUALIFICATIONS
  • Microsoft Office experience preferred
  • High School Diploma or GED required
  • Prior call center experience preferred
  • Prior office experience preferred
  • Be able to successfully pass a background screening
  • Employees must provide their own reliable internet if working a remote/hybrid position

The incumbent typically works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone, and other office equipment as needed to perform duties. The noise level in the work environment is typical of that of an office. Incumbents may encounter frequent interruptions throughout the workday. The employee is regularly required to sit, talk, or hear; frequently required to use repetitive hand motion, handle, or feel, and to stand, walk, reach, bend, or lift up to 20 pounds. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description_html:
JOB SUMMARY

As a Systems Engineer II, you will design, develop, and implement systems infrastructure, including hardware and software. You will support and maintain the organization’s environment while also managing special projects related to new technology implementations.


JOB DUTIES

  • Apply advanced problem-solving and decision-making skills while following security best practices, access controls, and all applicable legal, regulatory, and organizational policies
  • Maintain the skills and knowledge needed to coordinate workflow, prioritize and multitask effectively, and deliver high-quality customer service through clear written and verbal communication
  • Establish, configure, test, maintain, and monitor operating systems, servers, networking, application software, and system management tools
  • Manage server patching schedules, vulnerability remediation, software license assignment, and mobile device management (MDM) platforms
  • Monitor system and network performance, identify and resolve infrastructure alerts, and provide resource allocation recommendations to the Infrastructure Manager
  • Plan and implement system automation and efficiency improvements, including cost analysis procedures
  • Promptly respond to and resolve incidents and service requests within agreed-upon timeframes
  • Create, maintain, and standardize technical documentation, processes, and procedures
  • Monitor project deliverables and ensure timely completion of assigned initiatives
  • Support professional development through peer mentoring and training in clear, non-technical language
  • Participate in on-call rotation, perform after-hours work for system upgrades or outages, and travel up to 10 percent to remote offices, data centers, and headquarters in Missoula, Montana
  • Perform other duties as assigned


QUALIFICATIONS

  • Minimum 3 years IT Systems Engineering experience in a Microsoft environment
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology or equivalent experience
  • Relevant certification required (AZ-104, AZ-800, MCSE, MCSA, MS-102) or ability to obtain within 6 months
  • Demonstrated intermediate level knowledge in the Microsoft family of products including: Windows Operating Systems, Office 365, Intune, Azure, Powershell, Entra ID
  • Experience with virtual networks, storage, IAM, virtual machine and host management, hybrid infrastructure
  • Experience using cloud managed network devices such as Cisco Meraki
  • Be able to successfully pass a background screening
  • Employees must provide their own reliable internet if working a remote/hybrid position

The incumbent typically works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone and other office equipment as needed to perform duties. The noise level in the work environment is typical of that of an office. Incumbent may encounter frequent interruptions throughout the workday. The employee is regularly required to sit, talk, or hear; frequently required to use repetitive hand motion, handle or feel, and to stand, walk, reach, bend or lift up to 20 pounds.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description_html:
JOB SUMMARY

As a State Director, you will oversee the day to day operations of CDCN within the state, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and full compliance with all Federal and State regulations and Managed Care Organization (MCO) requirements. You will lead intake and referral operations, payroll and accounts receivable processes, staff training, and service delivery while driving financial performance, supporting client advocacy, and fostering a cohesive and collaborative office environment. 

JOB DUTIES

  • Direct collaboration with internal and external stakeholders to ensure effective service delivery, while representing the company at stakeholder meetings, health fairs, and provider fairs
  • Ensure compliance with all applicable legal requirements, standards, policies, and procedures at the program office level, including annual review and updates of policies, procedures, and standard operating procedures
  • Oversee program performance management, including responsibility for scorecards, dashboards, key performance indicators, advanced reporting, and the timely management of deliverables and projects
  • Maintain positive financial health of programs by directing payroll, authorizations, accounts receivable operations, budgets, and service/support plan development
  • Lead and manage complex service programs, special projects, program implementations, large-scale enrollments, and transitions as required
  • Direct recruitment, hiring, training, supervision, and professional development of employees, while assigning and participating in training activities
  • Provide strong organizational leadership through effective problem-solving, decision-making, prioritization, multitasking, dependability, and the coordination of workflows and efficiencies
  • Deliver excellent customer service to internal and external stakeholders and clients through effective written and verbal communication and proficient public speaking
  • Identify, implement, and monitor process improvement initiatives, including annual satisfaction survey review and implementation of program improvement efforts
  • Oversee client enrollment, assessments, supervisory visits, and marketing of services to referral sources
  • Direct the management and accuracy of the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) database and ensure timely updates
  • Demonstrate computer proficiency and maintain the necessary skills, knowledge, and relationships to support operational efficiency
  • Travel within the assigned geographic area as required
  • Bilingual skills preferred in various locations
  • Other duties as assigned


QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree in the field of Social Work, Psychology, Counseling, Rehabilitation, Nursing, Sociology or Related Field with one-year experience working with individual(s) with disabilities or the elderly 
  • Four (4) years management experience preferred
  • Ability to work flexible and/or extended hours, if needed, to meet the job requirements
  • If working hybrid, employee must provide their own reliable internet

The incumbent typically works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone and other office equipment as needed to perform duties. The noise level in the work environment is typical of that of an office. Incumbent may encounter frequent interruptions throughout the workday. The employee is regularly required to sit, talk, or hear; frequently required to use repetitive hand motion, handle or feel, and to stand, walk, reach, bend or lift up to 20 pounds.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description_html:
JOB SUMMARY

Authorizations associates are responsible for entering all client demographic packets and service authorizations to enable successful time entry and billing processes. They review the packets and authorizations for accuracy, identify any problems, and then troubleshoot any issues with our local offices. Additionally, they prepare basic reports that flag errors which would impact shift entry, payroll, and billing processes and work to resolve discrepancies in a timely manner.


JOB DUTIES

  • Process specifically assigned client packets, authorizations, and eligibility checks timely and accurately
  • Prepare and work reports to meet all deadlines for shift entry, payroll, and billing
  • Effectively communicate verbally and in writing
  • Comply with applicable legal requirements, standards, policies, and procedures
  • Demonstrate dependability
  • Engage in and facilitate positive and cohesive team environments
  • Demonstrate effective problem solving and decision-making skills
  • Exhibit computer efficiency
  • Maintain necessary skills and knowledge to coordinate workflow
  • Participate in professional development and training activities
  • Prioritize and multitask effectively
  • Provide excellent customer service to internal and external clients
  • Develop a working knowledge of additional entities to assist other service lines as need
  • Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Microsoft Office experience preferred
  • High School Diploma preferred
  • Prior office experience preferred
  • Be able to successfully pass a background screening
  • Employees must provide their own reliable internet if working a remote/hybrid position
 

The incumbent typically works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone, and other office equipment as needed to perform duties. The noise level in the work environment is typical of that of an office. Incumbent may encounter frequent interruptions throughout the workday. The employee is regularly required to sit, talk, or hear; frequently required to use repetitive hand motion, handle or feel, and to stand, walk, reach, bend or lift up to 20 pounds.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description_html:
JOB SUMMARY
 
The CDASS & IHSS Liaison provides coordination and support to Members and Authorized Representatives seeking and experiencing self-directed services with the Consumer Directed Attendant Support Services (CDASS) program or the In-Home Services & Supports (IHSS) program. In addition, this role is responsible for providing coordination and support within all parties including but not limited to the FMS and/or Agency, the Case Management agencies, Department staff and other stakeholders.
 
The Consumer Direct Care Network owners, executives, and employees work together to fulfill the company mission to provide care and support for people in their homes and communities. Our interactions with the people we serve and each other are guided by our commitment to our company values of Respect, Integrity, Service, and Excellence.


JOB DUTIES
  • Serving as Contractor’s CDASS and IHSS subject matter expert and primary contact for CMAs, IHSS Agencies, Participants, and stakeholders for program guidance and questions and ensuring that Member escalations are promptly and thoroughly resolved
  • Attending all Contractor trainings providing support to the Training Lead by addressing CDASS and IHSS questions, concerns, and feedback
  • Ensuring all written Contractor CDASS and IHSS information and documentation is consistent across all CMAs, IHSS
  • Agencies, FMS contractors, and the Department monitoring for changes in CDASS and IHSS rules, regulations, and policies applying updates, as necessary
  • Attending all meetings between the Department and FMS contractors, as directed by the Department, to ensure efficient operations between Contractor and FMS contractors
  • Attending, as requested, any Department Case Management meetings to provide applicable CDASS and IHSS information and support
  • In collaboration with other Key Personnel, developing and managing Contractor’s state marketing strategy to increase
  • Consumer Direction awareness and providing consultation to unaffiliated organizations on Consumer Direction to increase community engagement
  • Travel to various locations throughout Colorado as necessary to provide support for CDASS or IHSS Members or Authorized Representatives
  • Communicate and collaborate with CMA, FMSs, or Agencies as necessary to support a Member/ARs needs.
  • Review training curriculum documents for accuracy and completion while communicating
  • Complete appropriate and timely documentation on all activities of daily job performance
  • Assist in maintaining all databases and electronic files
  • Act as a troubleshooter for inquiry calls or drop-in visits regarding general program information or for client, Authorized
  • Representatives, and case manager complaints
  • Attend educational meetings, training sessions, and other meetings as needed or required by program
  • Maintain confidentiality regarding all communication/information related to clients, Authorized Representatives, attendants, and all business relations

QUALIFICATIONS
  • An Associate degree, or higher, from an accredited college or university; or at least four years of experience providing
  • administrative support
  • At least two years of experience in a customer-facing position
  • At least two years’ experience with Consumer Direction. Experience working with people with disabilities, the elderly, and low-income individuals
  • Employees must provide their own reliable internet if working a remote/hybrid position

The incumbent typically works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone and other office equipment as needed to perform duties. description_text:
JOB SUMMARY
The CDASS & IHSS Liaison provides coordination and support to Members and Authorized Representatives seeking and experiencing self-directed services with the Consumer Directed Attendant Support Services (CDASS) program or the In-Home Services & Supports (IHSS) program. In addition, this role is responsible for providing coordination and support within all parties including but not limited to the FMS and/or Agency, the Case Management agencies, Department staff and other stakeholders.
The Consumer Direct Care Network owners, executives, and employees work together to fulfill the company mission to provide care and support for people in their homes and communities. Our interactions with the people we serve and each other are guided by our commitment to our company values of Respect, Integrity, Service, and Excellence.
JOB DUTIES
Serving as Contractor’s CDASS and IHSS subject matter expert and primary contact for CMAs, IHSS Agencies, Participants, and stakeholders for program guidance and questions and ensuring that Member escalations are promptly and thoroughly resolved
Attending all Contractor trainings providing support to the Training Lead by addressing CDASS and IHSS questions, concerns, and feedback
Ensuring all written Contractor CDASS and IHSS information and documentation is consistent across all CMAs, IHSS
Agencies, FMS contractors, and the Department monitoring for changes in CDASS and IHSS rules, regulations, and policies applying updates, as necessary
Attending all meetings between the Department and FMS contractors, as directed by the Department, to ensure efficient operations between Contractor and FMS contractors
Attending, as requested, any Department Case Management meetings to provide applicable CDASS and IHSS information and support
In collaboration with other Key Personnel, developing and managing Contractor’s state marketing strategy to increase
Consumer Direction awareness and providing consultation to unaffiliated organizations on Consumer Direction to increase community engagement
Travel to various locations throughout Colorado as necessary to provide support for CDASS or IHSS Members or Authorized Representatives
Communicate and collaborate with CMA, FMSs, or Agencies as necessary to support a Member/ARs needs.
Review training curriculum documents for accuracy and completion while communicating
Complete appropriate and timely documentation on all activities of daily job performance
Assist in maintaining all databases and electronic files
Act as a troubleshooter for inquiry calls or drop-in visits regarding general program information or for client, Authorized
Representatives, and case manager complaints
Attend educational meetings, training sessions, and other meetings as needed or required by program
Maintain confidentiality regarding all communication/information related to clients, Authorized Representatives, attendants, and all business relations
QUALIFICATIONS
An Associate degree, or higher, from an accredited college or university; or at least four years of experience providing
administrative support
At least two years of experience in a customer-facing position
At least two years’ experience with Consumer Direction. Experience working with people with disabilities, the elderly, and low-income individuals
Employees must provide their own reliable internet if working a remote/hybrid position
The incumbent typically works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone and other office equipment as needed to perform duties. The noise level in the work environment is typical of that of an office. Incumbent may encounter frequent interruptions throughout the workday. The employee is regularly required to sit, talk, or hear; frequently required to use repetitive hand motion, handle or feel, and to stand, walk, reach, bend or lift up to 20 pounds. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description_html:
JOB SUMMARY

The Operations Supervisor is responsible for supervising the day-to-day operations of Consumer Direct Care Network programs while maintaining compliance with Federal/State Regulations and Managed Care Organization (MCO) program rules. This position is responsible for supervising general office affairs, maintaining continuous service quality, monitoring compliance with regulations, training administrative and program staff, and implementing special projects.  Responsible to behave in a manner that will promote cohesiveness to the office environment, as well as support day-to-day operations, and client advocacy.

 

JOB DUTIES

  • Oversee daily operations of Consumer Direct Care Network programs to support company strategic anchors and thematic goals
  • Oversee compliance with regulations and Managed Care Organization (MCO) program rules.
  • Oversee continuous service quality at the program level
  • Promote cohesiveness in the office environment
  • Oversee day-to-day operations and client advocacy
  • Collaborate with stakeholders regarding the delivery of services
  • Collect and analyze program scorecard, dashboard, and key performance indicators
  • Comfortable with public speaking
  • Communicate effectively
  • Oversee compliance with applicable legal requirements, standards, policies, and procedures
  • Oversee advanced reporting
  • Demonstrate dependability
  • Demonstrate effective problem-solving and decision-making skills
  • Exhibit computer efficiency
  • Oversee complex service programs and special projects
  • Identify and implement process improvement efforts
  • Oversee special projects including, but not limited to:
  • Annual review of policy and procedures
  • Annual review of standard operating procedures
  • Annual satisfaction survey
  • Large-scale enrollments and transitions as needed
  • Maintain necessary skills and knowledge to coordinate workflow
  • Market services to referral sources
  • Participate in, and assign professional development and training activities
  • Prioritize and multitask effectively
  • Provide excellent customer service to internal and external clients
  • Recruit, hire, train, and supervise employees
  • Represent the company at stakeholder meetings, health fairs, and provider fairs
  • Supervise deliverables and ensure timely completion of projects
  • Travel within the assigned geographic area as required
  • Oversee client enrollment, assessments, and supervisory visits as needed
  • Oversee certification and credentialing process for all service lines as needed
  • Ensures timely payroll processing by overseeing administrative functions as needed
  • Bilingual preferred in various locations
  • Other duties as assigned

 

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree preferred
  • 2-4 years office experience preferred
  • Combination of education and experience
  • 2 years leadership experience preferred
  • Ability to work flexible and/or extended hours, if needed, to meet the job requirements.
 
The incumbent typically works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone and other office equipment as needed to perform duties. The noise level in the work environment is typical of that of an office. Incumbent may encounter frequent interruptions throughout the workday. The employee is regularly required to sit, talk, or hear; frequently required to use repetitive hand motion, handle or feel, and to stand, walk, reach, bend or lift up to 20 pounds.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description_html:
JOB SUMMARY

Service/Program coordinators assist with daily intake and referral processes to set clients up for services, coordinating their in-home care needs in compliance with Federal/State Regulations and Managed Care Organization (MCO) program rules.  They maintain and coordinate a caseload of clients enrolled in Medicaid programs and conduct regular check-ins on clients to update care plans if that client’s needs change.

 

JOB DUTIES

  • Maintain and coordinate a caseload of clients enrolled in Medicaid programs
  • Coordinate clients’ in-home care needs in compliance with Federal/State Regulations, Managed Care Organization (MCO) program rules, and contract requirements
  • Assist with daily intake and referral processes to ensure positive business growth and development
  • Promote cohesiveness in the office environment
  • Support day-to-day operations and client advocacy
  • Ability to meet position requirements with little direct oversight
  • Collaborate with stakeholders regarding the delivery of services
  • Effective written and verbal communicator
  • Comply with applicable legal requirements, standards, policies, and procedures
  • Demonstrate dependability
  • Demonstrate effective problem-solving and decision-making skills
  • Exhibit computer efficiency
  • Handle complex service programs and special projects
  • Market services to referral sources as needed
  • Maintain necessary skills and knowledge to coordinate workflow
  • Participate in professional development and training activities
  • Prioritize and multitask effectively
  • Provide excellent customer service to internal and external clients
  • Represent the company at stakeholder meetings, health fairs, and provider fairs
  • Enroll clients and employees in services, web portal, and EVV systems as needed
  • Conduct necessary client assessments and home visits as required
  • Bilingual preferred in various locations
  • Answer and make phone calls and occasional video calls
  • Other duties as assigned

 

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree in the field of Social Work, Psychology, Counseling, Rehabilitation, Nursing, Sociology or Related Field preferred
  • 1 year of previous experience working with individuals with disabilities or the elderly preferred
  • Combination of education and experience

description_html:
JOB SUMMARY
Supports Brokers coordinate the day-to-day implementation of contractual requirements within the state’s Medicaid guidelines. Duties include training, enrolling, reporting, auditing, and complying with contract deliverables as well as ensuring company best practices are followed and upheld. The Support Broker/Consultant works with members on plan/budget development, submission, and revision.

JOB DUTIES
  • Apply a person-centered approach to keep the client at the center of all program functions
  • Coordinate the day-to-day implementation of contractual requirements within the state’s Medicaid guidelines
  • Create care plans based on the clients’ needs, train clients on services provided, audit services, and report findings to the contracted entity
  • Assist clients with plan/budget development, submissions, and revisions
  • Provide continuous excellent service to clients, employees, and 3rd party organizations including MCOs
  • Promote cohesiveness in the office environment
  • Support day-to-day operations and client advocacy
  • Collaborate with stakeholders regarding the delivery of services
  • Comfortable with public speaking
  • Communicate effectively
  • Comply with applicable legal requirements, standards, policies, and procedures
  • Conduct advanced reporting and oversight activities
  • Demonstrate dependability
  • Demonstrate effective problem-solving and decision-making skills
  • Exhibit computer efficiency
  • Handle complex service programs and special projects
  • Lead, supervise, and complete special projects including, but not limited to developing and implementing care plans
  • Maintain necessary skills and knowledge to coordinate workflow
  • Market services to referral sources
  • Participate in professional development and training activities
  • Prioritize and multitask effectively
  • Provide excellent customer service to internal and external clients
  • Represent the company at stakeholder meetings, health fairs, and provider fairs
  • Supervise deliverables and ensure timely completion of projects
  • Enroll clients and employees in services, including the development of the service/support plan and budget
  • Orient and educate clients on current program roles and responsibilities
  • Train and assist clients in timecard submission
  • Assist clients with eligibility requirements, as required by the program rules 
  • Travel to and from Client homes or other destinations to meet with Clients
  • Conduct necessary client assessments and contacts
  • Maintain timely and proper documentation in Customer Relationship Management (CRM) database
  • Compile information for internal or external auditors
  • Bilingual preferred in various locations
  • Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS
  • A four (4) year degree in the field of Human Services (psychology, sociology, social work, recreational therapy, education, nursing, physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech, etc.) and at least one (1) year professional experience working with one (1) of the following populations: elderly , adults with physical disabilities, individuals with intellectual disabilities and persons with developmental disabilities: or
  • A four (4) year degree in any other subject and two (2) years professional experience working with one (1) of the following populations: elderly , adults with physical disabilities, individuals with intellectual disabilities and persons with developmental disabilities: or
  • A two (2) year degree in Human Services (psychology, sociology, social work, recreational therapy, education, nursing, physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech, etc.) and at least five (5) year professional experience working with one (1) of the following populations: elderly , adults with physical disabilities, individuals with intellectual disabilities and persons with developmental disabilities.
  • Must have reliable transportation. If the employee will be driving, a valid driver's license and auto insurance is required.
  • This is a hybrid position and the employee must provide their own reliable Internet service.

The incumbent typically works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone and other office equipment as needed to perform duties. The noise level in the work environment is typical of that of an office. Incumbent may encounter frequent interruptions throughout the workday. The employee is regularly required to sit, talk, or hear; frequently required to use repetitive hand motion, handle or feel, and to stand, walk, reach, bend or lift up to 20 pounds. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description_html:
JOB SUMMARY

Program Coordinators assist with daily intake and referral processes to set clients up for services and coordinate their in-home care needs in compliance with Federal and State regulations, as well as Managed Care Organization (MCO) program rules. They maintain and support a caseload of clients enrolled in Medicaid programs and conduct regular check-ins to update care plans as needs change.

If you enjoy a role that gets you out of the office, this position offers frequent, planned travel to client locations within a three hour radius. You’ll be supported with either a company vehicle or mileage reimbursement to make travel smooth and manageable.

During your first 12 weeks of hire, you’ll complete new hire training that includes up to four in-person sessions in Dallas.

 

JOB DUTIES

  • Maintain and coordinate a caseload of clients enrolled in Medicaid programs
  • Travel frequently to client homes and community locations (approximately 90% of the role)
  • Participate in a 12-week new hire training program, including occasional travel to Dallas
  • Coordinate clients’ in-home care needs in alignment with Federal/State regulations, MCO program rules, and contract requirements
  • Assist with daily intake and referral processes to support positive business growth
  • Promote a collaborative and supportive office environment
  • Support day-to-day operations and client advocacy
  • Work independently and meet position requirements with minimal oversight
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to support service delivery
  • Communicate effectively—both written and verbal
  • Comply with all applicable legal requirements, standards, policies, and procedures
  • Demonstrate dependability and timely follow-through
  • Use sound problem-solving and decision-making skills
  • Exhibit strong computer proficiency
  • Manage complex service programs and special projects
  • Market services to referral sources as needed
  • Maintain necessary knowledge to coordinate workflow
  • Participate in professional development and training activities
  • Prioritize and multitask effectively in a fast-paced environment
  • Provide excellent customer service to internal and external stakeholders
  • Represent the organization at stakeholder meetings, health fairs, and provider fairs
  • Enroll clients and employees in services, web portals, and EVV systems as needed
  • Conduct client assessments and home visits as required
  • Answer and make calls, including occasional video calls
  • Other duties as assigned

 

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Demonstrate 1+ years of experience of in-person customer/client support
  • 1+ year of experience supporting individuals with disabilities or the elderly
  • Demonstrated commitment in a team environment by showing initiative, collaborating effectively, and contributing to a supportive and productive workplace
  • Equivalent combinations of education and experience considered
  • Bilingual candidates preferred in certain locations

The incumbent typically works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone and other office equipment as needed to perform duties. The noise level in the work environment is typical of that of an office. Incumbent may encounter frequent interruptions throughout the workday. The employee is regularly required to sit, talk, or hear; frequently required to use repetitive hand motion, handle or feel, and to stand, walk, reach, bend or lift up to 20 pounds. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description_html:
JOB SUMMARY

The Administrative Coordinator I coordinates administrative duties in compliance with Federal/State Regulations and Managed Care Organization (MCO) program rules. Responsible for handling customer service, including all inbound and outbound phone calls, emails, messages, and/or chats.   Coordinate and manage daily intake and referral processes to ensure positive business growth and development.  Process client and attendant enrollment paperwork.  Coordinate authorization processes and meet general customer service objectives to ensure positive business growth and development. Handle specialized tasks and/or projects as assigned. Responsible to behave in a manner that will promote cohesiveness to the office environment, as well as support day-to-day operations, and client advocacy.


JOB DUTIES

  • Provide excellent customer service to internal and external clients.
  • Handle inbound/outbound phone calls, providing accurate answers to queries and concerns.
  • De-escalate situations involving dissatisfied customers, offering assistance and support.
  • Provide administrative and clerical support including mailing, scanning, faxing, and data entry tasks.
  • Process forms and documents in relevant systems
  • Support accounts receivable efforts by auditing service authorizations for accuracy and facilitating corrections from MCO representatives.
  • Communicate effectively.
  • Comply with applicable legal requirements, standards, and policies, and procedures.
  • Maintain the necessary skills and knowledge to coordinate workflow.
  • Exhibit an intermediate level of computer efficiency.
  • Demonstrate effective problem-solving and decision-making skills.
  • Participate in professional development and training activities.
  • Bi-lingual preferred in various locations
  • Other duties as assigned
 

QUALIFICATIONS

  • High School Diploma or GED preferred
  • Previous office experience preferred
  • Combination of education and experience
  • Experience working with Fiscal Intermediary Agency (FEA) programs preferred
  • Be able to successfully pass a background screening
 

The incumbent typically works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone and other office equipment as needed to perform duties. The noise level in the work environment is typical of that of an office. Incumbent may encounter frequent interruptions throughout the workday. The employee is regularly required to sit, talk, or hear; frequently required to use repetitive hand motion, handle or feel, and to stand, walk, reach, bend or lift up to 20 pounds.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description_html:
JOB SUMMARY
The HR Investigations Specialist will play a critical role in researching and investigating allegations of time card fraud, Medicaid fraud, and general reports of concern within a large population of unionized caregivers. The primary focus will be on investigating and resolving issues related to time card fraud, ensuring compliance with company policies, union agreements, and relevant labor laws.


JOB DUTIES
  • Support high-volume HAD (Harassment, Abuse, Discrimination) and AEN (Abuse, Exploitation, Neglect) case overflow, maintaining accuracy, timeliness, and adherence to performance metrics.
  • Conduct thorough investigations into reports or suspicions of time card fraud among unionized caregivers.
  • Research and analyze time sheet data, training records, witness statements, and other documentation to identify irregularities, discrepancies, or patterns indicating potential fraud or lack of character, competency, or suitability to provide care.
  • Maintain meticulous records of investigations, documenting interviews, findings, and any evidence collected.
  • Ensure the preservation of electronic and physical evidence in accordance with company policies and legal requirements.
  • Collaborate closely with Human Resources and Labor Relations departments to ensure investigations align with company policies, union agreements, and applicable labor laws.
  • Provide timely and accurate updates on the progress of investigations.
  • Recommend and implement appropriate corrective actions based on investigation outcomes.
  • Support HR Business Partners during administrative investigations through thorough note-taking and documentation.
  • Other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS
  • Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, or related field.
  • Two or more years of experience in a related or similar position.
  • Proven experience in conducting employee relations investigations.
  • Familiarity of relevant labor laws, union agreements, and HR best practices.
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.
  • Efficiency with Outlook, Word, Excel, and SharePoint.
  • Ability to work flexible and/or extended hours, if needed, to meet the job requirements
  • Employees must provide their own reliable internet if working a remote/hybrid position

The incumbent typically works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone and other office equipment as needed to perform duties. The noise level in the work environment is typical of that of an office. Incumbent may encounter frequent interruptions throughout the workday. The employee is regularly required to sit, talk, or hear; frequently required to use repetitive hand motion, handle or feel, and to stand, walk, reach, bend or lift up to 20 pounds. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description_html:
JOB SUMMARY
 
The Senior Director of Enterprise Application Delivery is a strategic technology leader responsible for overseeing the planning, development, and delivery of enterprise-wide application platforms. This role ensures that application solutions meet business needs, are scalable, and are delivered efficiently across global teams. The position includes direct oversight of both onshore and offshore teams, requiring strong cross-cultural leadership and vendor management skills.


JOB DUTIES

Strategic Leadership
  • Develop and execute the enterprise application delivery strategy aligned with organizational goals.
  • Drive digital transformation initiatives and application modernization efforts.
  • Collaborate with senior leadership to identify and prioritize technology investments.
Team & Delivery Management
  • Lead a global team of application professionals, including onshore and offshore developers, analysts, and project managers.
  • Establish and manage delivery models that leverage offshore capabilities for scalability and cost-effectiveness.
  • Ensure consistent performance, quality, and accountability across distributed teams.
Stakeholder Engagement
  • Partner with business units to understand requirements and deliver application solutions that drive value.
  • Act as a trusted advisor to stakeholders, ensuring transparency and alignment throughout the delivery lifecycle.
Technology Oversight
  • Oversee enterprise platforms such as ERP, CRM, HRIS, and custom applications.
  • Ensure robust system integration, data governance, and security compliance.
  • Evaluate emerging technologies and recommend adoption where appropriate.
Governance & Budget
  • Manage budgets for application delivery, including offshore vendor contracts and service agreements.
  • Implement governance frameworks for application development, change management, and performance metrics.
  • Monitor KPIs and SLAs to ensure service excellence across all delivery channels.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field (Master’s preferred).
  • 10+ years of experience in enterprise application delivery, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role.
  • Proven experience managing offshore teams and global delivery models.
  • Strong understanding of enterprise architecture, cloud platforms, and integration frameworks.
  • Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
  • Experience with platforms such as SAP, Oracle, Salesforce, Workday, or Microsoft Dynamics is a plus.
  • Agile and DevOps methodologies, preferred.
  • Experience with global vendor management and contract negotiation, preferred.
  • Change management and organizational transformation expertise preferred.
  • Ability to work flexible and/or extended hours, if needed, to meet the job requirements
  • Employees must provide their own reliable internet if working a remote/hybrid position

The incumbent typically works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone and other office equipment as needed to perform duties. The noise level in the work environment is typical of that of an office. Incumbent may encounter frequent interruptions throughout the workday. The employee is regularly required to sit, talk, or hear; frequently required to use repetitive hand motion, handle or feel, and to stand, walk, reach, bend or lift up to 20 pounds.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description_html:
JOB SUMMARY

The Financial Analyst III will lead financial deliverables, contribute to overall department goals and assist in onboarding of new employees. Successful employees will be eager to solve problems, be willing to support other teams, communicate with confidence on financial matters, and understand as well as apply organizational goals.

 

JOB DUTIES

  • Conduct strategic financial analysis
  • Analyze current and past trends in key performance indicators in all areas of revenue, cost of sales, expenses, and capital expenditures
  • Monitor performance indicators, highlighting trends and analyzing causes of unexpected variance
  • Maintain and cloud based financial forecasting system
  • Ad-Hoc Reporting and Analysis
  • Quarterly and Monthly Financial reports
  • Promote cohesiveness in the office environment
  • Support day-to-day operations and client advocacy
  • Collaborate with stakeholders regarding delivery of services, as needed, based on program requirements
  • Possess and utilize a thorough understanding of financial statements and CDCN financial structure
  • Conduct advanced reporting and oversight activities
  • Improve performance by evaluating processes to drive efficiencies and understand ROI in operations and investments
  • Develop financial models and analyses to support business operations
  • Use SQL server to mine relevant financial and statistical data to leverage in analysis
  • Effective written and verbal communication
  • Provide excellent customer service to internal and external clients
  • Approach business problems with a solution-oriented mindset
  • Comply with applicable legal requirements, standards, policies, and procedures
  • Demonstrate dependability
  • Demonstrate effective problem solving and decision-making skills
  • Lead and execute special projects
  • Maintain necessary skills and knowledge to coordinate work flow
  • Monitor deliverables and ensure timely completion of projects
  • Participate in professional development and training activities
  • Prioritize and multitask effectively
  • Other duties as assigned 

 

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree required – relevant field preferred
  • Master’s degree, applicable professional certifications preferred
  • 3-5 years’ experience preferred
  • Be able to successfully pass a background screening
  • If working remote, employee must provide their own reliable internet
  • Ability to work flexible and/or extended hours, if needed, to meet the job requirements.

 

The incumbent typically works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone and other office equipment as needed to perform duties. description_html:
Now Hiring: Respite Care Provider for Energetic Sibling Duo!

We’re looking for a kind, patient, and dependable respite care provider to support two loving and active brothers with Autism and ADHD. These bright, energetic boys thrive in structured, creative environments and need a caregiver who can balance fun with calm, consistent support.

This role is ideal for someone who enjoys engaging activities, values routine, and is passionate about making a positive difference in children’s lives.
 
Location: Elk Mound, WI
Compensation: $518.64/weekend
Schedule: One weekend per month
 
What You’ll Do
• Provide supervision, companionship, and a safe environment for two young brothers.
• Support daily routines and assist with emotional regulation.
• Engage in fun, age-appropriate activities at home and in the community.
• Encourage social skills, independence, and positive behavior.
• Give caregivers valuable respite time.

What We’re Looking For
• Experience working with children with Autism (preferred).
• Patient, dependable, and calm in energetic situations.
• Active, creative, and a positive role model.
• CPR certified (or willing to complete within 30 days of hire).
• Comfortable in the family’s home and on community outings.
• Reliable transportation and ability to pass a background check.

Why Join Us?
If you’re compassionate, reliable, and love working with kids, this is a meaningful opportunity to support a family and build lasting connections with two awesome boys!

Are you compassionate, reliable and have great communication skills? Do you love helping people? Do you love working with youth and families?

If you answered yes to the above, we would love to hear from you! Position is for a young girl. More details about kiddo are discussed during the interview!
 
Benefits: You will be working for a family that is very appreciative of what you do! You would be helping a family live their best life!
 
Hours/Desired Schedule
o Wednesday- Friday
o 7am-8:30am
o Mornings before school
 
Pay: $17.66 per hour
 
Tasks

• Meal prep/eating help/feeding tube
• Bathing
• Dressing
• Toileting
• Transferring
 
Child likes
• Dinosaurs and ducks
• Books
• Being outside
• Children's museum 
• Library
• Ripping paper, pouring, and dumping things

• Active and outgoing personality

Willing to undergo a caregiver background check prior to hire 
Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation

If you answered yes to the above, we would love to hear from you! Position is for a young boy. More details about kiddo are discussed during the interview!
 
Benefits: You will be working for a family that is very appreciative of what you do! You would be helping a family live their best life!
 
Hours/Desired Schedule
o 4 days a month
o Occasional 10 hours a week, afternoons
 
Location: Providers home and community
 
Pay
• $207.45 per overnight 
• $14.13 an hour
 
Tasks
• Kiddo has some behaviors that need monitor and help regulate
• Help learn new habits and hobbies
• Help be more active
• Be like a mentor
• Meal prep
 
Child likes
• Sports
• Being outdoors
• Construction and welding
• Playing guitar
 
Preferred Qualifications
• Patient & Thoughtful in Speech and communication
• Active and outgoing personality 
 
Requirements*
• Willing to undergo a caregiver background check prior to hire 
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation

description_html:
Are you looking to make a difference in the lives of a loving family? We are searching for a caring Child Respite Provider to support 2 special boys in their home. The ideal candidate will be confident, patient, and possess a passion for caregiving. Experience preferred working with individuals with high physical needs; however family is willing to train the right candidate.
  
Location: Wausau, WI
Wage: $17.70/hr 
Schedule: 15-20 hours per week (after school/occasional weekends)
 
Responsibilities:
• Transfers (Hoyer Lifts)
• Feedings (G-Tubes)
• Bathing/Dressing
• Toileting
• Medication Assistance, if needed
• Play time/Interaction
 
Qualifications:
• Age 18 or older at start of employment
• Experience working with children with special needs
• Willing to undergo a background check

description_html:
Are you compassionate, reliable and have great communication skills? Do you love helping people? Do you love working with youth and families?

If you answered yes to the above, we would love to hear from you! Positions are for a variety of kiddos of age and gender. More details about kiddo are discussed during the interview!

Positions available
• Hours vary from 8 hours a week to 30 hours
• Pay ranges from $10-$17 an hour
• Bloomer, WI
• Eau Claire, WI
• Menomonie, WI
• New Auburn, WI

Tasks may include:
• Meal Prep/ Feeding tubes
• Housekeeping (tasks related only to member)
• Community outings (park/mall/movies)
• Arts and crafts
• Playing with kiddos
• Dressing kiddos as needed
• Transferring kiddos as needed
• Medications management
• Transportation as needed

Benefits:
• You will be working for a family that is very appreciative of what you do! You would be helping a family live their best life!  
• Flexible scheduling
• Possible mileage

What are we looking for?:
•  Positive attitude, reliability, and hard-working candidates encouraged to apply!
• Flexible scheduling
• Must be willing to have background check completed
• Valid driver's license
• Experience with caregiving recommended but not required
• New applicants wanting to start respite are welcome!

If you answered yes to the above, we would love to hear from you! Personal care worker in Eau Claire or the surrounding area! 
 
Benefits: You will be working for a family that is very appreciative of what you do! You would be helping a family live their best life!  
 
Schedule:
• 40 hours a month
• Flexible schedule to be planned with the managing party 
 
Pay: $16 per hour 
 
Responsibilities:
• Supervise and engage the siblings in a safe and supportive environment 
• Facilitate activities and de-escalate conflicts 
• Foster healthy communication and cooperation between the children 
• Provide feedback to the family and assist with light household duties (meal prep, tidying) 
 
Sibling A likes
• Playing with clay 
• Painting 
• Playdough
• Reading
• Toys
 
Sibling B likes
• Art
• Cartoons
• Creating stories
• Reading
• Legos
• Games 
 
Preferred Qualifications:
• Patient & Thoughtful in Speech and communication
• Active and outgoing personality

• Willing to undergo a caregiver background check prior to hire 
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation

description_html:
Are you compassionate, reliable, and able to remain calm under pressure? Do you love helping children thrive? Do you enjoy supporting families and creating positive experiences in their homes and communities?

If you answered yes to the above, we would love to hear from you! Position is for a young boy. More details about the kiddo will be discussed during the interview!
 
Benefits:
You will be working with a family that deeply appreciates the care you provide. You would be helping a child feel safe, supported, and comfortable in his daily routines—making a meaningful difference for the whole family.
 
Wage:
$14.13 per hour
$207.45 per day shift
 
Schedule and Location:
• 6 hours a week
• One full day per month
• Every other weekend, 6 AM–2 PM
• Care takes place primarily in the member’s home, with some community outings
 
Responsibilities:
• Provide calm support when the child becomes upset
• Gentle redirection as needed
• Engage in enjoyable activities such as games, movies, coloring, or park visits
• Support safe use of tablet, movies, and preferred routines
 
Member Likes:
• Games and cartoons
• Playing at the park
• Car rides
• Tablet time and coloring
• Superheroes, Minecraft, Disney (especially Lilo & Stitch)
 
Preferred Qualifications:
• Patient & calm when the child is upset
• Strong communication skills
• Ability to remain steady and supportive during challenging moments
 
Requirements*:
• Willing to undergo a caregiver background check prior to hire
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation

description_html:
Are you compassionate, reliable, and great at connecting with kids? Do you love helping families and supporting children in their own homes?

If you answered yes to the above, we would love to hear from you! Position is for a young boy. More details about the kiddo will be discussed during the interview.

Wage:
$14.13 per hour
$207.45 per day shift
 
Schedule and Location:
• 10 hours a week
• 2 days a month
• Family is flexible and able to work around provider schedules
• Most days the family is not home until 2 PM (Fridays more flexible)
• Care will take place in the family’s home to start
 
Responsibilities:
• Meal prep
• Assistance with feeding
• Playtime and interactive engagement (a major part of the role)
• Supervision for safety (no elopement concern inside the home or yard)
 
Member Likes:
• Very social and loves people
• Animals (his biggest obsession!)
• Legos and trains
• Playing outside
• Pretend play
• Autism diagnosis but not severe; sweet, gentle, and well-behaved
• Speech delay but can be understood
 
Triggers:
• No known triggers
• Does well with boundaries
 
Preferred Qualifications:
• Patient and engaging
• Enjoys interactive play
• Strong communication and calm presence
 
Requirements*:
• Willing to undergo a caregiver background check prior to hire
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation

description_html:
Sibling Respite Provider Needed
 
A lovely family in the Chippewa Falls area is seeking a compassionate and dependable Sibling Respite Provider to offer support and care for two young children. This role involves spending time with the children in their home and community, engaging them in fun, meaningful activities, and ensuring a safe and nurturing environment while providing the family with valuable respite time. If you enjoy creating meaningful experiences for children and want to make a difference in a family’s life, we’d love to hear from you!
 
Pay: $17.70/hour
Location: Respite to take place in the child's home & community (Chippewa Falls, WI)
Schedule: 10 hours/week available - Afternoons/evenings preferred – flexible schedule TBD between family & provider
 
Child 1: Female, School-aged
• Enjoys: 
o Tv/movies/characters: MOANA (current favorite), Mario (Princess Peach) 
o Going out into the community
o Coloring & Drawing 
o Being outside
o Going to the park or fun community events 
o Playing on her tablet – limit screen time

Child 2: Male, Toddler
• Enjoys
o Songs & playing instruments 
o Playing on his climbing blocks 
o Music & attention

What You’ll Do:
• Engage the children in play and community activities
• Provide supervision and support with basic personal care routines for AJ (bathing, dressing, restroom reminders)
• Encourage positive social interaction and a safe, nurturing environment
• Assist with routine activities around the home or outings in the community
 
Ideal Candidate:
• Open to regular communication with the family and adaptable to a changing schedule.
• Energetic, engaging, dependable, and compassionate
• Comfortable supporting children with developmental disabilities
• CPR/First Aid (or willingness to obtain) preferred
• Prior experience working with children is helpful but not required
 
Requirements:
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation 
• Willing to undergo a caregiver background check upon hire

description_html:
We are looking for an experienced Respite Provider in special needs childcare to assist a young girl in the family home on weekends.

The child has Angelman’s Syndrome and needs significant supervision and behavioral management. 
 
She does enjoy hanging out and having fun! So outgoing personalities are a plus!
This client enjoys watching movies on her Roku, going to concerts, reading books, eating out, water related activities, and so much more!
 
Compensation: $17.66 an hour
 
Shifts: Weekends - Respite care provided in the child’s home, flexible scheduling.
 
Responsibilities:
•        Engaging child and encouraging appropriate behaviors. 
•        1:1 safety supervision-line of sight at all times
•        Assist with regulation techniques during heightened behaviors
•        Ability to set firm boundaries that are beneficial to the child to assist with managing behaviors
•        Provide Safety and companionship
•        Assist with daily living tasks: changing, bathing, transferring to and from wheelchair, meal prep, feeding, and basic household chores
•        Provide emotional and behavioral support
 
Qualifications:
•        Experience managing frequently erratic behaviors that can be aggressive. 
•        Prior experience with special needs required
•        Experience with Autism spectrum, behavioral disorders, and Angelman’s syndrome required
•        Valid Driver's License and reliable transportation.
•        Must be at least 18 years of age at the start of employment.
•        Must be comfortable with pets in the home. -Family has multiple small dogs in the home.
•        Pass background check before hire.

• Bloomer, WI

description_html:
Do you love helping people? Do you love working with youth and families? Positions are for young males.

The ideal candidate will enjoy spending time with kids, especially those who love being active and exploring the community! More details about kiddo are discussed during the interview!
 
Posting is for 3 different positions
 
Hours/Desired Schedule:
• Possible combined hours 25 hours a week and 2 days a month
• Afterschool hours
• Monday - Friday
 
Pay: $14.13 an hour and $207.45 per day (Shift 8-24 hours)
Location: In the community, providers home
 
Kiddos enjoy:
• Watching movies
• WWE
• Sports (Baseball and football)
• Playing games 
• Outdoor activities 
• Going to local parks
 
Job Responsibilities:
• Community outings (Action City, YMCA, Children's Musuem)
• Actively participate in both indoor and outdoor activities
• Meal Prep
• Medication reminders
• Cueing for tasks
• Providing a safe, supportive, and positive environment
 
We’re Looking for Someone Who Is:
• Comfortable engaging with children in a patient and encouraging way
• Active and outgoing personality 
• Using positive behavior techniques when needed
• Support emotional regulation and help the child use his coping skills during challenging moments
 
Requirements*:
• Willing to undergo a caregiver background check prior to hire 
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation

description_html:
Are you compassionate, reliable, and able to remain calm under pressure? Do you love helping children thrive? Do you enjoy supporting families and creating positive experiences in their homes and communities?

If you answered yes to the above, we would love to hear from you! Position is for a young boy. More details about the kiddo will be discussed during the interview!
 
Benefits:
You will be working with a family that deeply appreciates the care you provide. You would be helping a child feel safe, supported, and comfortable in his daily routines—making a meaningful difference for the whole family.
 
Wage:
$14.13 per hour
$207.45 per day shift
 
Schedule and Location:
• 6 hours a week
• One full day per month
• Every other weekend, 6 AM–2 PM
• Care takes place primarily in the member’s home, with some community outings
 
Responsibilities:
• Provide calm support when the child becomes upset
• Gentle redirection as needed
• Engage in enjoyable activities such as games, movies, coloring, or park visits
• Support safe use of tablet, movies, and preferred routines
 
Member Likes:
• Games and cartoons
• Playing at the park
• Car rides
• Tablet time and coloring
• Superheroes, Minecraft, Disney (especially Lilo & Stitch)
 
Preferred Qualifications:
• Patient & calm when the child is upset
• Strong communication skills
• Ability to remain steady and supportive during challenging moments
 
Requirements*:
• Willing to undergo a caregiver background check prior to hire
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation

description_html:
We are looking for an engaging Respite Provider to hang out with an awesome 11-year-old boy!

This child loves playing games on the computer, riding his scooter, swimming, and soccer. He also enjoys going out into the community and learning new things. 
 
Respite care will be conducted in the provider’s (your) home or in the child's home. Community outings are also encouraged.
 
Hours:
• 8 hours a week.
• 6 days per month.
 
Pay:
• $14.13/hour (shifts under 8 hours)
• $207.45/day (shifts over 8 hours) 
 
Schedule:
• Flexible! Schedule to be discussed and determined between provider and family.
• Typically during afternoons, evenings, and weekends.

Tasks:
• Supervision and Safety Awareness
• Building Life Skills,  Confidence, and Independence
• Modeling Positive Behaviors
• Companionship and Social Engagement
• Provide transportation to/from community activities
• Engage with client and encourage appropriate behaviors.
 
Qualifications:
• Authorized to work in the U.S.
• Criminal/Caregiver background check
• Valid driver's license, reliable transportation, and automobile insurance required
• High School Teens encouraged to apply
•  Males encouraged to apply

description_html:
We are seeking a Respite Provider to provide respite for siblings (an 11-year-old boy and a 10-year-old girl), focusing on supervision and emotional regulation, while having fun. This gives parents some temporary relief to rest, refresh, and recharge!

The girl likes arts and crafts, card games, gymnastics, dance, and music. The boy likes video games, Nintendo, Minecraft, making board games, graphic novels, and soccer.

Respite care for the children will be in their home. Community Outing is encouraged.

Wages
· $17.70/hour (working with both children)
· $14.13/hour  (working per child - individual) 
· $259.32 (8 hour or more) (working with both children)
                
Schedule
· 10 hours a week (working with both children)
· 2 hours per week per child. (working per child- individual)
· 2 days per month (working with both children)
· Flexible Scheduling

description_html:
PART-TIME RESPITE PROVIDER  – Chippewa Falls, WI
Are you compassionate, reliable, and looking for a rewarding part-time opportunity that makes a difference in someone’s life? We’re looking for a fun and caring Respite Provider to spend quality time with a wonderful kiddo while parents take care of errands and daily responsibilities. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys connecting with children, creating joyful experiences, and offering a helping hand to families who truly appreciate your support. You’ll have the chance to make a positive impact each day by providing supervision, companionship, and encouragement in the comfort of the family’s home.
 
SHIFTS:
• 13 hours per week
o 4 hrs per week is flexible
o 2 hrs on Sunday mornings
o Every other weekend for 7 hrs
• 1 overnight per month
• Flexible scheduling — you and the family can coordinate days and times that work best for both of you.
 
WAGE:
• $17.66 per hour + Mileage Reimbursement
• $256.00 per overnight (shifts over 8 hrs)

WHAT THE KIDDO LOVES TO DO THAT I HOPE YOU DO TOO:

You’ll be spending time with an energetic and fun-loving kiddo who enjoys:
• Listening to music and dancing to favorite songs
• Crash pad time — a fun way to get the wiggles out!
• Visual and sensory play that keeps things engaging
• Snack time — because good snacks make everything better!

If you’re creative, playful, and enjoy hands-on activities, you’ll be a great match for this position.
 
REQUIREMENTS:
• Valid Driver’s License
• Reliable transportation to and from the family’s home
• Must pass a background check
• A friendly, dependable, and patient personality — experience working with kids or individuals with disabilities is a plus, but not required
 
WHY IS THIS JOB SO SPECIAL:
This is more than just a part-time job — it’s an opportunity to make a real difference. You’ll be providing valuable respite to a family that deeply appreciates your time and care. Each shift brings the chance to build meaningful connections and create moments of laughter, comfort, and joy.

You’ll gain hands-on caregiving experience, flexible hours, and the satisfaction of knowing your work truly matters. If you’re someone who finds joy in helping others and creating positive experiences, we’d love to hear from you!

description_html:
We are currently seeking a kind, patient, and outgoing Respite Provider for a very sweet and active little boy. This young man is on the Autism spectrum (no experience required, just openness to learn). He is mainly nonverbal but will sometimes use his words to communicate his needs. The family is open to him being around other children, but is unsure how he will interact with them. 1:1 would also be great. This creative young man is very talented with drawing and building, and would love someone who would encourage these qualities.
 
Pay: $14.13/hour (after tax rate)
Location: Chippewa Falls, WI 
Schedule: 4 hours/week available - SAT & SUN afternoons preferred - flexible shifts

Things He Enjoys:
• Disney movies – Likes the music and stories (Loves the movie Cars!) 
• Loves Building Things & Drawing (buildings & airplanes)
• Climbing
• Swimming 
• Playing outside
Passes: YMCA & Chippewa Falls Pool
 
Key Responsibilities:
• Foster an open and communicative relationship to build trust and help him feel comfortable.
• Help him stay busy and engaged with activities to maintain an active lifestyle

Ideal Candidate:
• A kind, patient, and energetic individual who can offer a safe and fun environment 
• Someone who enjoys outdoor activities and is willing to be active and engaged in various physical tasks.
• Open to regular communication with the family and adaptable to a changing schedule.
• Experience with Autism is helpful but not required

Personal Cares
• Hourly restroom reminders

Requirements:
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation 
• Willing to undergo a caregiver background check upon hire

description_html:
DAY TIME/FULL TIME SUMMER CHILDCARE PROVIDER – Chippewa Falls, WI
Are you compassionate, patient, and looking for a meaningful way to make a difference in someone’s life? We are seeking a fun and dependable respite provider to spend quality time with a wonderful kiddo while parents are away at work during the summer and days off from school. This position offers the unique opportunity to make a positive impact by helping a young individual thrive in their home environment.
 
As a childcare provider, you’ll offer care, companionship, and supervision while engaging in activities that the child loves. This is not just a job — it’s a chance to bring joy, laughter, and support to a family who truly values what you do.
 
SHIFTS:
• Monday - Friday 8AM-4:30PM
• Summer care & days off from school
 
WAGE:
• $11.77 per hour
• Additional pay may be discussed during the interview process based on experience and availability

WHAT THE KIDDO LOVES TO DO THAT I HOPE YOU DO TOO:

This young kiddo is full of energy, curiosity, and joy! Some favorite activities include:
• Listening to music and dancing to fun tunes
• Crash pad time to get the wiggles out and stay active
• Enjoying visual stimulation and sensory play
• Snack time — because who doesn’t love a good snack break?
 
REQUIREMENTS:
• Valid Driver’s License
• Reliable transportation to and from the family’s home
• Must pass a background check
• A kind, patient, and dependable attitude — experience working with kids or individuals with disabilities is a plus, but not required.
 
WHY IS THIS JOB SO SPECIAL:
You’ll be supporting a family that truly appreciates the care you provide. Every hour you spend helps make their lives easier and their child’s life more enjoyable. You’ll gain hands-on experience in caregiving, build meaningful relationships, and be part of something that genuinely matters.

If you’re looking for a position that’s rewarding, flexible, and full of heart, this could be the perfect fit for you!

description_html:
Seeking a dependable, kind Transportation Provider in Eagle River to assist a friendly adult male with special needs. Brief 10-minute trips, 2x daily, Monday–Thursday. Commitment of up to 2 days/week, with backup availability preferred. Minimal assistance required. Consistent routine and positive interactions. The ideal provider will be reliable and punctual, patient and respectful, and able to commit to a consistent weekly schedule.  This is a great opportunity for someone looking for a meaningful, part-time work with predictable hours. 

Location: Eagle River, WI 

Schedule:
•            Preferred Days of Week: Tuesdays and Wednesdays, with the potential to        
               work Mondays and Thursday as backup/fill in
•            Morning Drop-Off: Arrive at the members home at 7:15AM and transport member to
               designated drop off point
•            Afternoon Pick-Up: Return to the drop-off point at 4:50PM and transport member 
               home.
   
Wage: 
•            Hourly Rate: $16.32-$18.48 per hour.
•            Mileage Reimbursement: Eligible for both loaded and unloaded mileage       
               reimbursement.

Position Responsibilities
•            Provide punctual and dependable transportation based on the schedule.
•            Ensure member safety during all transport.
•            Assist the member with buckling his seatbelt, as he needs help fastening it at times.
•            Maintain a clean and safe vehicle.
•            Demonstrate patience, professionalism, and clear communication.
•            Follow all traffic laws and agency safety expectations.
 
Requirements
•            Valid driver's license, reliable, insured vehicle, and clean driving record.
•            Strong time-management skills and ability to consistently meet at scheduled  
               pickup and drop-off times on time.   
•            Comfortable providing minimal physical assistance (seatbelt buckling).
•            Experience with special needs caregiving preferred
•            Willing to undergo Criminal /Caregiver background check.

We are looking for a kind, patient, and dependable Child Respite Provider to support a wonderful young non-verbal girl with autism in the Wausau area. Care will take place both in the community and in your home.

The ideal provider genuinely enjoys working with children, has experience with special needs (especially autism), and brings a calm, positive attitude. Most important is someone who can connect with her, have fun, and help keep her safe and happy.

This little girl enjoys outdoor activities, nature exploration, arts and crafts, visits to parks and museums, educational activities, and using her tablet.

• 20 hours/week 
• Monday-Friday - 4:30PM-6:30PM
