description_html:
We are seeking a kind, reliable, and experienced Child Respite Worker to provide attentive care, supervision, and meaningful companionship for young twin boys with autism and limited speech.

Respite care will initially take place in the children’s home to support comfort, consistency, and relationship-building. As trust and familiarity develop, there may be an opportunity for care to transition to the respite provider’s home.

The ideal candidate will be patient, dependable, and confident to support 2 children with special needs. Experience working with children on the autism spectrum is strongly preferred.

The boys enjoy: pretend play, games, playing outside, power wheels, and videos on the tablet.

Location: Eau Claire, WI 
Wage: $17.70 per hour/$259.32 per day (shifts over 8 hours)

Hours: Possible schedule scenarios below to be agreed upon/developed by family and provider.
• Up to 5 hours per week - Saturdays from 1pm to 4pm. 
• 1-2 Days per month – Saturdays – (shifts over 8 hours with potential for overnights)

Duties:
• Supervision: be attentive to both boys at all times 
• Personal Cares: bathing assistance, toileting/diaper changes/toilet training
• Meal Prep/snacks
• Community outings/public events
• Redirect behaviors appropriately

Qualifications:
• Previous experience working with children with special needs, including those on the Autism Spectrum.
• Confidence in your abilities and skills to provide exceptional, compassionate care.
• Demonstrates appropriate, positive behavior and able to maintain healthy professional boundaries.
• Valid driver’s license, reliable transportation, and current auto insurance.
• Willingness to commit to be a long-term provider 
• Family prefers FEMALE non-smokers
description_text:
We are seeking a kind, reliable, and experienced
Child Respite Worker
to provide attentive care, supervision, and meaningful companionship for young twin boys with autism and limited speech.
Respite care will initially take place in the children’s home to support comfort, consistency, and relationship-building. As trust and familiarity develop, there may be an opportunity for care to transition to the respite provider’s home.
The ideal candidate will be patient, dependable, and confident to support 2 children with special needs. Experience working with children on the autism spectrum is strongly preferred.
The boys enjoy: pretend play, games, playing outside, power wheels, and videos on the tablet.
Location
: Eau Claire, WI
Wage
:
$17.70 per hour/$259.32 per day (
shifts over 8 hours
)
Hours: Possible schedule scenarios below to be agreed upon/developed by family and provider.
•
Up to 5 hours per week - Saturdays from 1pm to 4pm.
•
1-2 Days per month – Saturdays – (shifts over 8 hours with potential for overnights)
Duties:
•
Supervision:
be attentive to both boys at all times
•
Personal Cares:
bathing assistance, toileting/diaper changes/toilet training
•
Meal Prep/snacks
•
Community outings/public events
•
Redirect behaviors appropriately
Qualifications:
•
Previous experience working with children with special needs, including those on the Autism Spectrum.
•
Confidence in your abilities and skills to provide exceptional, compassionate care.
•
Demonstrates appropriate, positive behavior and able to maintain healthy professional boundaries.
•
Valid driver’s license, reliable transportation, and current auto insurance.
•
Willingness to commit to be a long-term provider
•
Family prefers FEMALE non-smokers

description_html:
We are seeking a caring, dependable Child Respite Provider to support two young brothers on the autism spectrum. Care will take place in their home, where they feel most comfortable, safe, and secure. Both boys are mostly non-verbal, so a patient, calm, and creative approach to communication is essential. They thrive with consistency, gentle routines, and compassionate support from someone who recognizes and values their unique strengths.

The ideal candidate is reliable, kind, and attentive, with a genuine interest in supporting special needs children.  Experience with autism or non-verbal communication is strongly preferred.

The boys enjoy: toys, toy cars, waterplay, and people watching.

Location: Weston, WI
Wage:  $17.70 per hour/$259.32 per day
Shift: 80 hours per month 
               4 days per month – prefer Saturdays or Sundays

Responsibilities:
  • Care/Supervision/Companionship
  • Effective non-verbal communication strategies, visual supports or other provided tools.
  • Cares: Toileting (assistance child with wiping/clean up), Meal Prep/snacks 
  • Redirect and deescalate behaviors as needed while being patient and calm

Qualifications:
  • Valid Driver’s License, reliable vehicle, & auto insurance
  • Previous experience working with special needs children/Autism
  • Willing to undergo a background check prior to hire

description_html:
We are seeking a kind and experienced Specialized Childcare Provider to care for a male toddler with special healthcare needs at home.

The ideal candidate will be patient, dependable, and skilled in providing safe, nurturing, specialized care that supports the child’s development and overall well-being. This role requires someone who is attentive, consistent, positive, and committed to providing high-quality care.

This little boy enjoys toys, toy cars and trucks, the movie Cars, being outside, the sandbox, walks, trips to the library, and reading books.

Location: Menomonee Falls, WI
Wage: up to $25 per hour – based on experience
Schedule: Up to 35 hours per week
                        8:30am to 4:30pm: Mondays/Thursdays/Fridays

Responsibilities:
• Provide attentive, nurturing care in a safe and supportive home environment
• Perform G-tube feedings/medication administration with confidence and precision.
• Other cares may include bathing, dressing, diaper changes/toilet training, and perform household duties relation to the care you provide, i.e. cleaning up after meals, doing dishes and cleaning up after activities.  
• Engage the child in age-appropriate activities/play that support comfort and development
• Communicate clearly and effectively with parents and care team members

Qualifications:
• Age 18 or older at start of employment
• 1st Aide/CPR certification preferred
• C.N.A. certification with GTUBE experience preferred, but willing to train/refresh training for someone with prior G-Tube experience
• FEMALE PROVIDERS PREFERRED BY FAMILY
• MUST HAVE Valid Driver’s License, reliable transportation, and auto insurance
• Willing to undergo a background check prior to hire

description_html:
We’re looking for a kind, patient, and dependable Child Respite Provider to care for two young brothers with special needs. Respite will take place in the provider’s home and/or out in the community, giving their family some much-needed time to reset and recharge.

The ideal provider will be compassionate, confident, and comfortable supporting children with developmental disabilities. Previous experience working with children with special needs is required.

These boys enjoy watching cartoons, playing with toy trucks and cars, blocks, dinosaur toys, and being outdoors.

Location:  Fall Creek, WI (Eau Claire County)
Wage: $17.70 per hour
Schedule: 5 hours per week – Prefers Saturdays or Sundays 1pm to 6pm

Responsibilities:
  • Supervision/Companionship
  • Cares: Toileting (assistance wiping/pull up change/clothing adjustment if necessary) Meal Prep
  • Redirect and deescalate behaviors appropriately as needed with a calm manner/positive attitude
  • Outings with both boys in their community for activities

Qualifications:
  • 5 years of previous experience with special needs children/Autism preferred
  • Valid Driver’s License, reliable vehicle, and auto insurance REQUIRED. 
  • Provide a safe, engaging environment to provide respite services in your home. 
  • The family prefers providers to have HS Diploma/GED and be at least 21 years of age or older.

description_html:
Experienced Companion Care Provider
*Family prefers a FEMALE AND NON-SMOKING PROVIDER 
Location: Madison, WI

Schedule: 
• Part-time BACK UP/FILL IN - afternoon work (no later than 4pm)
• 2 to 5 hours per week possible. Coverage needed for provider illnesses and vacations.

Wage: $16.32 to $25.00 per hour -based on experience

Creative, smart, pleasant woman artist, retired from a professional life in politics advocating for equality, needs a backup/fill in Companion Provider to spend time with her and accompany her to activities a few times a week. This role is ideal for someone who not only understands the basics and nuances of interacting with people with dementia but also values connection, promoting independence, and humor.

Key Responsibilities:
• Provide warm, respectful, easy conversation and fun companionship both at home and in the community
• Provide continuous attentive monitoring for needs, safety, and well-being, positively redirecting when needed, while promoting independence.
• Enjoy conversations on topics of mutual interest or new topics. Explore her and your shared interests and pursue activities related to those. 
• Help her maintain her abilities and routines to support her current baseline 
• Bring a sense of calm, ease, enjoyment, and laughter to daily interactions 
• Use your vehicle to take the member on local community outings.

The Ideal Candidate Will:
• Have training and experience working with individuals living with dementia
• Be observant, patient, and respectful of boundaries
• Possess excellent communication skills and a good sense of humor 
• Be flexible and able to adapt to changing needs and routines
• Understand how to foster autonomy while providing appropriate support

This is a wonderful opportunity for someone who enjoys meaningful, one-on-one companion care and truly values making a difference in someone’s day.

This woman enjoys: Art- especially painting, doing art- pen and paper, art history, women’s and feminist art, women’s history, history, politics, political movements, gardening, flowers, walks or sitting in nature, conversations with people who have diverse interests like her. Also enjoys younger kids, and animals – dogs, cats, horses.

Tasks to be incorporated into all shifts:
• Half hour walks around the block 
• Having the woman ready aloud to you for a period of time. 
• Activities at home (doing art, sewing, etc) and/or outings: library (weekly), going to art galleries, art shows, art museums, gardens and parks, music, Wingra park walking path and sitting by the lakeshore. Errands like going to get her hair cut.
• Sometimes light cleaning

Requirements:
18 years of age or older with a high school diploma or GED
Experience working with people with dementia for at least 1 year 
Provider references verifying personal/professional experience
Valid Driver’s License, reliable vehicle, auto insurance(comprehensive), and a clean driving record
Willing to do a background check
Family prefers FEMALE caregivers and non-smokers

description_html:
DAY TIME/FULL TIME SUMMER CHILDCARE PROVIDER – Chippewa Falls, WI

Are you compassionate, patient, and looking for a meaningful way to make a difference in someone’s life? We are seeking a fun and dependable respite provider to spend quality time with a wonderful kiddo while parents are away at work during the summer and days off from school. This position offers the unique opportunity to make a positive impact by helping a young individual thrive in their home environment.
 
As a childcare provider, you’ll offer care, companionship, and supervision while engaging in activities that the child loves. This is not just a job — it’s a chance to bring joy, laughter, and support to a family who truly values what you do.
 
SHIFTS:
• Monday - Friday 8AM-4:30PM
• Summer care & days off from school
 
WAGE:
• $11.77 per day
• Additional pay may be discussed during the interview process based on experience and availability

WHAT THE KIDDO LOVES TO DO THAT I HOPE YOU DO TOO:

This young kiddo is full of energy, curiosity, and joy! Some favorite activities include:
• Listening to music and dancing to fun tunes
• Crash pad time to get the wiggles out and stay active
• Enjoying visual stimulation and sensory play
• Snack time — because who doesn’t love a good snack break?
 
REQUIREMENTS:
• Valid Driver’s License
• Reliable transportation to and from the family’s home
• Must pass a background check
• A kind, patient, and dependable attitude — experience working with kids or individuals with disabilities is a plus but not required.
 
WHY IS THIS JOB SO SPECIAL:
You’ll be supporting a family that truly appreciates the care you provide. Every hour you spend helps make their lives easier and their child’s life more enjoyable. You’ll gain hands-on experience in caregiving, build meaningful relationships, and be part of something that genuinely matters.

If you’re looking for a position that’s rewarding, flexible, and full of heart, this could be the perfect fit for you!

description_html:
PART-TIME RESPITE PROVIDER  – Chippewa Falls, WI

Are you compassionate, reliable, and looking for a rewarding part-time opportunity that makes a difference in someone’s life? We’re looking for a fun and caring respite provider to spend quality time with a wonderful kiddo while parents take care of errands and daily responsibilities. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys connecting with children, creating joyful experiences, and offering a helping hand to families who truly appreciate your support. You’ll have the chance to make a positive impact each day by providing supervision, companionship, and encouragement in the comfort of the family’s home.
 
SHIFTS:
• 13 hours per week
o 4 hrs per week is flexible
o 2 hrs on Sunday mornings
o Every other weekend for 7 hrs
• 1 overnight per month
• Flexible scheduling — you and the family can coordinate days and times that work best for both of you.
 
WAGE:
• $17.66 per hour + Mileage Reimbursement
• $256.00 per overnight (shifts over 8 hrs)

WHAT THE KIDDO LOVES TO DO THAT I HOPE YOU DO TOO:

You’ll be spending time with an energetic and fun-loving kiddo who enjoys:
• Listening to music and dancing to favorite songs
• Crash pad time — a fun way to get the wiggles out!
• Visual and sensory play that keeps things engaging
• Snack time — because good snacks make everything better!
If you’re creative, playful, and enjoy hands-on activities, you’ll be a great match for this position.
 
REQUIREMENTS:
• Valid Driver’s License
• Reliable transportation to and from the family’s home
• Must pass a background check
• A friendly, dependable, and patient personality — experience working with kids or individuals with disabilities is a plus, but not required
 
WHY IS THIS JOB SO SPECIAL:
This is more than just a part-time job — it’s an opportunity to make a real difference. You’ll be providing valuable respite to a family that deeply appreciates your time and care. Each shift brings the chance to build meaningful connections and create moments of laughter, comfort, and joy.

You’ll gain hands-on caregiving experience, flexible hours, and the satisfaction of knowing your work truly matters. If you’re someone who finds joy in helping others and creating positive experiences, we’d love to hear from you!

description_html:
Currently seeking a friendly and reliable Part-Time Caregiver to work 11p-7a every Saturday and Sunday. The ideal candidate will have experience working with individuals with high physical needs in a home setting and be located in or near Brown Deer, WI.

Pay: $20.00/hour 
Schedule: Every Saturday and Sunday, 11 pm to 7 am

Tasks:
• Care is to be provided in member’s home
• Assist with transfers (Hoyer Lift)
• Assist with feedings (G Tube, suctioning)
• Assist with bathing and getting dressed
• Assist with toileting, when needed
• Assist with medications, when needed
• Above all, provide safety and companionship

Qualifications:
• Valid Driver's License -or- reliable transportation to and from shifts.
• Prior experience working with feeding tubes and Hoyer lifts required.   
• Must be at least 18 years of age at the start of employment.
• Must pass background check.

description_html:
We are seeking a compassionate and dependable Youth Respite Provider to offer support, companionship, and guidance to a youth in the Eau Claire area. The ideal candidate will be active and engaging, possess excellent communication skills, be patient, and have a background in Mental Health. 

Schedule:
6 hours per week: After-school and Weekends - position is flexible!
4 days per month: To be determined based on family and Respite Provider scheduling.

Tasks:
• Ensure safety of client while under your supervision
• Provide motivation to be active, both at home and in the community
• Offer transportation to/from community locations, as needed (e.g., soccer, appointments, outings)
• Provide companionship and engage with the client in meaningful ways to encourage social connection
• Redirect behaviors as needed

Qualifications:
• Must have a valid Driver's License and reliable transportation
• Must have auto insurance
• Must pass background check
• Prior experience working with individuals with Mental Health a plus 
• Ability to follow care plans and communicate with the family/care team

description_html:
We are seeking an experienced Child Respite Provider to support a creative and energetic young boy with special needs. The ideal candidate will be confident, energetic, and patient. This role requires your willingness to engage in positive activities with the boy to have meaningful interactions during respite time. You will also use your skills to guide and support the boy through various challenges, helping him make positive choices in a safe and encouraging environment.
 
This boy enjoys: Animals, bike riding, being outdoors, fishing, parks, video games (Roblox), trampoline park, and paper crafts (origami, paper airplanes)
 
Location: Green Bay, WI
Wage: $17.66/hour
Schedule: 8-10 hours per week- Saturdays and Sundays
 
Responsibilities:
Provide 1:1 mentoring, companionship, and supervision
Educate the boy on important life skills, decision-making processes and problem solving.
Foster a supportive relationship with open communication, respect, and trust.
Provide transportation from afterschool program to respite location.
 
Qualifications:
• Age 18 or older at start of employment
• Valid Driver’s license, reliable transportation, and auto insurance
• Experience working with children with special needs
• Willing to undergo a background check
description_text:
We are seeking an experienced
Child Respite Provider
to support a creative and energetic young boy with special needs. The ideal candidate will be confident, energetic, and patient. This role requires your willingness to engage in positive activities with the boy to have meaningful interactions during respite time. You will also use your skills to guide and support the boy through various challenges, helping him make positive choices in a safe and encouraging environment.
This boy enjoys: Animals, bike riding, being outdoors, fishing, parks, video games (Roblox), trampoline park, and paper crafts (origami, paper airplanes)
Location
: Green Bay, WI
Wage
: $17.66/hour
Schedule
: 8-10 hours per week- Saturdays and Sundays
Responsibilities:
Provide 1:1 mentoring, companionship, and supervision
Educate the boy on important life skills, decision-making processes and problem solving.
Foster a supportive relationship with open communication, respect, and trust.
Provide transportation from afterschool program to respite location.
Qualifications:
•
Age 18 or older at start of employment
•
Valid Driver’s license, reliable transportation, and auto insurance
•
Experience working with children with special needs
•
Willing to undergo a background check

description_html:
Two Full-Time Direct Support professionals are needed in a family home, providing care for the family. Positions require a vehicle, insurance, and a valid driver's license to assist with errands and appointments.  
 
SHIFTS:
• First and Second Shift – 40 hours a week  
 
COMPENSATION:
• $16.32-$19.00 an hour based on experience 
• Mileage reimbursement for errands and appointment transportation 
 
QUALIFICATIONS:
• Experience with Autism, Physical Limitations and Mental Health
• Preference for older, experienced caregivers who are reliable and dependable 
• No cell phone usage except for emergencies while working 
• Both shifts require caregivers to stay awake on shift 
• Experience in being patient and respectful of boundaries while working with clients 
 
RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Assisting in helping man with Autism do all daily personal care tasks (showering, toileting, etc.) 
• Helping to ensure man with Autism is clean after toileting 
• Assisting in teaching daily life skills to man with Autism 
• Assist with self-regulation techniques for man with Autism
• Verbal motivation for adult male in home with daily life skills 
• Helping Mother w/physical limitations and family with laundry
• Other duties include: meal prep/cooking, housekeeping, dishes, grocery shopping and errands  
 
*Must be authorized to work in the U.S and pass a criminal background check 
*Position requires driver's license, auto insurance and reliable vehicle for errands 
*Working with individuals on the Spectrum and Adult Mental health required

description_html:
We are seeking a Respite Provider to provide respite for siblings (an 11-year-old boy and a 10-year-old girl), focusing on supervision and emotional regulation, while having fun. This gives parents some temporary relief to rest, refresh, and recharge!

The girl likes arts and crafts, card games, gymnastics, dance, and music.
The boy likes video games, Nintendo, Minecraft, making board games, graphic novels, and soccer.

Respite care for the children will be in their home. Community outings are encouraged.
 
Wages:
• $17.70/hour (working with both children)
• $14.13/hour  (working per child - individual) 
• $259.32 (8 hour or more) (working with both children)
 
Schedule:
• 10 hours a week (working with both children)
• 2 hours per week per child. (working per child- individual)
• 2 days per month (working with both children)
• Flexible Scheduling 
• Mostly afternoon, evenings, and overnights.
• Schedule will be discussed with family
 
Job Duties:
• Supervision 
• Safety Awareness
• Meal Prep Assistance
• Assisting with Routines and schedules
• Emotion Regulations
• Encouraging positive role modeling and behavior.
• Reminders with Activities of Daily Living.
 
Requirements:
• Authorized to work in the U.S.
• Criminal/caregiver background check
• Valid driver's license, reliable transportation, and automobile insurance required
• Experience working with children with Autism and Development Disabilities preferred
• Experience working with children with Mental Health and Disabilities preferred
• Understanding of LGBTQ and Cultural Practices understanding is preferred.
• Ability to work in a pet friendly environment. 
• Females encouraged to apply.

description_html:
We are looking for an engaging Respite Provider to hang out with an awesome 11-year-old boy!

This child loves playing games on the computer, riding his scooter, swimming, and playing soccer. He also enjoys going out into the community and learning new things. 
 
Respite care will be conducted in the provider’s (your) home or in the child's home.  Community outings are also encouraged.
 
Hours:
• 8 hours a week.
• 6 days per month.
 
Pay:
• $14.13/hour (shifts under 8 hours)
• $207.45/day (shifts over 8 hours) 
 
Schedule:
• Flexible! Schedule to be discussed and determined between provider and family.
• Typically during afternoons, evenings, and weekends.

Tasks:
• Supervision and Safety Awareness
• Building Life Skills,  Confidence, and Independence
• Modeling Positive Behaviors
• Companionship and Social Engagement
• Provide transportation to/from community activities
• Engage with client and encourage appropriate behaviors.
 
Qualifications:
• Authorized to work in the U.S.
• Criminal/Caregiver background check
• Valid driver's license, reliable transportation, and automobile insurance required
• High School Teens encouraged to apply
• Males encouraged to apply

description_html:
A lovely family in the Chippewa Falls area is seeking a compassionate and dependable Sibling Respite Provider to offer support and care for two young children. This role involves spending time with the children in their home and community, engaging them in fun, meaningful activities, and ensuring a safe, nurturing environment while providing the family with valuable respite. If you enjoy creating meaningful experiences for children and want to make a difference in a family’s life, we’d love to hear from you!
 
Pay: $17.70/hour
Location: Respite to take place in the child's home & community (Chippewa Falls, WI)
Schedule: 10 hours/week available - Afternoons/evenings preferred – flexible schedule TBD between family & provider
 
Child 1: Female, School aged
• Enjoys: 
o Tv/movies/characters: MOANA (current favorite), Mario (Princess Peach) 
o Going out into the community
o Coloring & Drawing 
o Being outside
o Going to the park or fun community events 
o Playing on her tablet – limit screen time

Child 2: Male, Toddler
• Enjoys
o Songs & playing instruments 
o Playing on his climbing blocks 
o Music & attention  
 
Passes: YMCA
 
What You’ll Do:
• Engage the children in play and community activities
• Provide supervision and support with basic personal care routines for AJ (bathing, dressing, restroom reminders)
• Encourage positive social interaction and a safe, nurturing environment
• Assist with routine activities around the home or outings in the community
 
Ideal Candidate:
• Open to regular communication with the family and adaptable to a changing schedule.
• Energetic, engaging, dependable, and compassionate
• Comfortable supporting children with developmental disabilities
• CPR/First Aid (or willingness to obtain) preferred
• Prior experience working with children is helpful but not required
 
Requirements:
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation 
• Willing to undergo a caregiver background check upon hire

description_html:
We are looking for an experienced Respite Provider in special needs childcare to assist a young girl in the family home on weekends. The child has Angelman’s Syndrome and needs significant supervision and behavioral management. She does enjoy hanging out and having fun, so outgoing personalities are a plus!

This client enjoys watching movies on her Roku, going to concerts, reading books, eating out, water-related activities, and so much more!
 
Compensation:
$17.66 an hour
 
Shifts:
Weekends-Respite care provided in the child’s home, flexible scheduling.
 
Responsibilities:
• Engaging child and encouraging appropriate behaviors. 
• 1:1 safety supervision-line of sight at all times
• Assist with regulation techniques during heightened behaviors
• Ability to set firm boundaries that are beneficial to the child to assist with managing behaviors
• Provide Safety and companionship
• Assist with daily living tasks: changing, bathing, transfer to and from wheelchair, meal prep, feeding, and basic household chores
• Provide emotional and behavioral support
 
Qualifications:
• Experience managing frequently erratic behaviors that can be aggressive. 
• Prior experience with special needs required
• Experience with Autism spectrum, behavioral disorders, and Angelman’s syndrome required
• Valid Driver's License and reliable transportation.
• Must be at least 18 years of age at the start of employment.
• Must be comfortable with pets in home. -Family has multiple small dogs in home.
• Pass background check before hire.

description_html:
We are seeking a compassionate, patient, and experienced In-Home Caregiver to support a nonverbal male with Down Syndrome. This position requires someone who is confident, calm, and able to redirect behaviors while providing hands-on care and meaningful engagement. Respite care will be conducted in the provider’s (your) home. Community outings are also encouraged.
 
Location: Altoona, WI
Wage: $241.26 per day 
 
Schedule:
• Friday evening - Sunday evening
• 4 days a month (2-weekends)
• Overnight Hours
• Flexible Schedule
 
Job Responsibilities:
• Supervision and Safety Awareness
• Assisting with Activities of Daily Living (Bathing, Dressing, Grooming etc.)
• Assisting with Toileting and Incontinent.
• Meal Preparation
• Feeding with G- Tube
• Housekeeping
• Modeling Positive Behaviors
• Companionship and Social Engagement

Qualifications:
• Authorized to work in the U.S.
• Valid Driver's license/vehicle insurance/reliable vehicle required
• Must pass a background check before hiring
• Experience with mental/behavioral health adults preferred.
• Experience working with individuals with Down Syndrome preferred.
• Experience with nonverbal children or adults preferred.
• Comfort with G-Tube feeding (or willingness to learn)

description_html:
POSITION SUMMARY

As a Direct Care Worker, you will be at the forefront of the company working in a rewarding, challenging, and dynamic environment as the go-to person for our members! In this important role, you will be responsible for supporting individuals of all ages with disabilities to high-risk members in need of immediate assistance. You will provide care for those who choose to maintain a quality of life in their own homes and communities. Successful candidates could manage up to five members per day, give or take depending on the caseload and will travel to the member’s residence to provide in-home services. These services are typically directed by a state plan to adequately assist and provide outstanding and personalized day-to-day care for each member.

In the Consumer Direct Care Network, our employees are committed, dependable, professional and accountable. We value integrity, honesty and respect for others. We have high standards for how our employees conduct themselves at work and in the communities, we support. Come join our team and be a part of a rewarding career helping others!


WHAT YOU WILL DO

  • Provide compassionate, empathetic, and professional in-home care to elderly and physically disabled members. Consistently uphold a client-focused approach.
  • Complete daily personal care and light housekeeping tasks for members in the home, including but not limited to: assistance with bathing, laundry, making beds, cooking meals, toileting, shopping, assistance with dressing, etc.
  • Show competency in time management and multi-tasking, while utilizing strong active-listening skills.
  • Strive to exceed the needs of the members in accordance with company, federal, and state guidelines.
  • Display an optimistic and flexible personality, capable of receiving direction and feedback.
  • Respectfully communicate with members, family, administrative employees, etc. on a daily basis.
  • Work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment. Work both independently, and with teammates at times. Must be self-sufficient and effectively use resources to best serve the needs of the members.
  • Ability to interact, evaluate circumstances, and subsequently offer solutions. Effectively display good judgment in making decisions and reporting emergencies.
  • Maintains confidentiality and does not discuss identifying information of any member outside of the company.


QUALIFICATIONS

  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Pass a physical lift test of 50lbs or more
  • Possess or ability to pass Background Check
  • Current CPR and First Aid Certificates, online accepted during COVID-19

These services are typically directed by a state plan to adequately assist and provide outstanding and personalized day-to-day care for each member.

In the Consumer Direct Care Network, our employees are committed, dependable, professional and accountable. We value integrity, honesty and respect for others. We have high standards for how our employees conduct themselves at work and in the communities, we support. Come join our team and be a part of a rewarding career helping others!


WHAT YOU WILL DO

  • Provide compassionate, empathetic, and professional in-home care to elderly and physically disabled members. Consistently uphold a client-focused approach.
  • Complete daily personal care and light housekeeping tasks for members in the home, including but not limited to: assistance with bathing, laundry, making beds, cooking meals, toileting, shopping, assistance with dressing, etc.
  • Show competency in time management and multi-tasking, while utilizing strong active-listening skills.
  • Strive to exceed the needs of the members in accordance with company, federal, and state guidelines.
  • Display an optimistic and flexible personality, capable of receiving direction and feedback.
  • Respectfully communicate with members, family, administrative employees, etc. on a daily basis.
  • Work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment. Work both independently, and with teammates at times. Must be self-sufficient and effectively use resources to best serve the needs of the members.
  • Ability to interact, evaluate circumstances, and subsequently offer solutions. Effectively display good judgment in making decisions and reporting emergencies.
  • Maintains confidentiality and does not discuss identifying information of any member outside of the company.


QUALIFICATIONS

  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Pass a physical lift test of 50lbs or more
  • Possess or ability to pass Background Check
  • Current CPR and First Aid Certificates, online accepted during COVID-19

description_html:
We are looking for a Direct Support Professional to assist a lovely woman in her home in the Platteville area. We need long-term care staff to assist a lady to stay in her home.
 
Needing the following shifts:
27 hours per week
First shift 8am-1pm
Second shift 3pm-8pm
Third shift 12am-5am

Compensation:
Starting at $18 an hour
 
Qualifications:

description_html:
We are looking for a caring Caregiver who wants part-time hours with the OPTION to cover regular caregiving staff for vacation and sick time. 
 
Compensation: $19/hr.

Schedule: Every other weekend, Saturday & Sunday, 12pm-1pm

Additionally, looking for someone who could be available for coverage during the following hours if/when primary caregivers are unavailable:
Monday -Friday; 7a.m.-9a.m
Monday -Friday; 12p.m.-1p.m.
Monday -Friday; 5p.m.-7:30a.m.

TASKS:
Every other weekend, Saturday & Sunday, 12pm-1pm:
• Prep lunch
• Assist with eating
• Lunch cleanup

Monday-Friday Back-Up, if needed:
• Assist with ADLs to include bathing, dressing, grooming, toileting, eating, medications, mobility, and transfers. 
• Comfortable assisting with adaptive equipment (i.e., wheelchair)
• Comfortable with pivot transfers
• Comfortable assisting with enemas when needed

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Valid Driver's License and reliable transportation.
• Must be at least 18 years of age at the start of employment.
• Must pass background check.

description_html:
We are looking for an engaging Respite Provider to hang out 1:1 with an awesome 5-year-old client to give mom some time for self-care! 

Pay: $14.13 an hour
Schedule: 5 hours a week -Primarily weekends and some after-school supports

Tasks:
• Engage with the client and encourage appropriate behaviors.
• 1:1 safety supervision
• Assist with self-regulation techniques during heightened behaviors
• Ability to set firm boundaries that are healthy and beneficial to the child to assist with managing behaviors. 
• Provide safety and companionship. Assist with emotional and behavioral support
• Assist with daily living tasks, including changing briefs, bathing, and assist with meal prep, and provide companionship in and out of the home. 

Qualifications:
• Previous experience working with children with behavior issues
• Valid Driver's License and reliable transportation
• Pass background check before hire

description_html:
Overview:
We are seeking a compassionate and skilled Home Care Nurse to join our team. As a Home Care Nurse, you will provide personalized skilled nursing care to members in the comfort of their own homes. This is a rewarding opportunity to make a positive impact on the lives of individuals in need.

Duties:
- Conduct comprehensive assessments of health status
- Develop and implement individualized care plans
- Observes, identifies, and documents any signs and symptoms of changes in the client’s physical, emotional/mental/social condition, reactions and medications, and environmental safety factors.
- Administer medications and treatments as prescribed
- Maintains accurate and timely records and observes the confidentiality of the medical record
- Educate members and their families on proper healthcare procedures and disease management
- Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to ensure coordinated and effective care

Skills:
- Strong knowledge of human anatomy and physiology
- Competence in medication administration
- Adhere to professional/industry standards of practice/care

Requirements:
- Valid nursing license in MT
- Excellent communication, documentation, and interpersonal skills
- Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively
- Current driver's license and auto insurance
- Current BLS certification

description_html:
Two full-time Direct Support Professional positions in a family home, providing care for the family. Positions require a vehicle, insurance, and a valid driver's license to assist with errands and appointments.  
 
SHIFTS:
• First and Second Shift – 40 hours a week  
 
COMPENSATION:
• $16.32-$19.00 an hour based on experience 
• Mileage reimbursement for errands and appointment transportation 
 
QUALIFICATIONS:
• Experience with Autism, Physical Limitations and Mental Health
• Preference for older, experienced caregivers who are reliable and dependable 
• No cell phone usage except for emergencies while working 
• Both shifts require caregivers to stay awake on shift 
• Experience in being patient and respectful of boundaries while working with clients 
 
RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Assisting in helping man with Autism do all daily personal care tasks (showering, toileting, etc) 
• Helping to ensure man with Autism is clean after toileting 
• Assisting in teaching daily life skills to man with Autism 
• Assist with self-regulation techniques for man with Autism
• Verbal motivation for adult male in home with daily life skills 
• Helping Mother w/physical limitations and family with laundry
• Other duties include: meal prep/cooking, housekeeping, dishes, grocery shopping and errands  

*Must be authorized to work in the U.S and pass a criminal background check 
*Position requires driver's license, auto insurance and reliable vehicle for errands 
*Working with individuals on the Spectrum and Adult Mental health required

description_html:
Are you a compassionate, dedicated individual seeking a rewarding caregiving role? We have an exciting opportunity for a full-time caregiver to join a loving Mom and Son duo in their Madison home. This position offers a competitive wage and a flexible 40-hour work week.

As a caregiver, you will play a vital role in enhancing this family's quality of life by assisting with a variety of tasks.

Your responsibilities will include housekeeping, laundry, grocery shopping, running errands, and supporting personal hygiene needs. Additionally, you will help with meal preparation and cooking to ensure nutritious and delicious meals for the household. 

Requirements:
  • Valid Driver’s License, Insurance, and Reliable Transportation
  • No Cell Phone Use During Work Hours unless Emergent
  • Successfully Pass Background Check
  • Experienced in working with individuals with Mental Health/Autism
  • Fun Personality!

***No allergies to cats- the family has 3***

This role is perfect for someone who is empathetic, reliable, and eager to make a difference in the lives of others. If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, we would love to hear from you!

We are seeking a compassionate and dependable Youth Respite Provider to offer support, companionship, and guidance to a youth in the Eau Claire area. The right candidate will be active and engaging, have great communication skills, be patient, and possess a background in Mental Health.

Pay:
$14.13/hourly rate
$207.45/daily rate

Schedule:
6 hours per week: Afterschool and Weekends- position is flexible!
4 days per month: To be determined based on family and Respite Provider scheduling.

Tasks:
• Ensure safety of client while under your supervision
• Provide motivation to be active, both at home and in the community
• Offer transportation to/from community locations, as needed (e.g., soccer, appointments, outings)
• Provide companionship and engage with the client in meaningful ways to encourage social connection
• Redirect behaviors as needed

Qualifications:
• Must have a valid Driver's License and reliable transportation
• Must have auto insurance
• Must pass background check
• Prior experience working with individuals with Mental Health a plus 
• Ability to follow care plans and communicate with the family/care team

description_html:
We are searching for an experienced Child Respite Provider to support a creative, energetic young boy with special needs. The ideal candidate will be confident, energetic, and patient. This role requires your willingness to engage in positive activities with the boy to have meaningful interactions during respite time. You will also use your skills to guide and support the boy through various challenges, helping him make positive choices in a safe and encouraging environment.
 
This boy enjoys: Animals, bike riding, being outdoors, fishing, parks, video games (Roblox), trampoline park, and paper crafts (origami, paper airplanes)
 
Location: Green Bay, WI
Wage: $17.66/hour
Schedule: 8-10 hours per week- Saturdays and Sundays
 
Responsibilities:
Provide 1:1 mentoring, companionship, and supervision
Educate the boy on important life skills, decision-making processes and problem solving.
Foster a supportive relationship with open communication, respect, and trust.
Provide transportation from afterschool program to respite location.
 
Qualifications:
• Age 18 or older at start of employment
• Valid Driver’s license, reliable transportation, and auto insurance
• Experience working with children with special needs
• Willing to undergo a background check

description_html:
We are seeking compassionate, reliable, and dedicated caregivers to join a team providing 24/7 in-home support for a woman requiring consistent, hands-on assistance with her daily needs. This meaningful role offers the opportunity to positively impact not only her physical well-being but also her emotional comfort, dignity, and overall quality of life.

The ideal candidate will have experience in hospice, palliative, or long-term care, understand the sensitivities of end-of-life support, and be committed to fostering a calm, respectful, and patient-centered environment.
 
Location: Watertown, WI
Compensation: $16.32 - $17.32/hour
Availability Needed: Flexible daytime hours - UP TO FULL TIME!
Flexibility: Hours available based on applicant availability
Commitment: Reliability and clear communication are essential
 
Key Responsibilities
• Provide hands-on assistance with daily living: bathing, grooming, dressing, and mobility.
• Support toileting, repositioning, catheter/ostomy care, and medical equipment use.
• Prepare meals, assist with feeding, and perform light household tasks (laundry, sweeping, etc.).
• Accompany the client to appointments or outings using a handicap-accessible van.
• Maintain clear communication with care team.

Qualifications
• Minimum 1 year of caregiving experience (elderly care preferred).
• CNA certification preferred but not required.
• Reliable transportation, valid driver’s license, and auto insurance.
• Strong communication skills, kindness, and dependability.
• Must pass caregiver and criminal background checks.

Why This Role Matters
Your care can bring comfort, safety, and dignity to someone’s daily life. If you’re looking to make an immediate, meaningful impact and provide critical support to someone in need, we want to hear from you!

description_html:
Youth Respite Provider – Safety, Support & Emotional Regulation

We are seeking a caring Youth Respite Provider to support a vibrant young boy with autism in the Black River Falls area. This meaningful role focuses on one-on-one care that emphasizes emotional regulation and structured support.

The ideal candidate is patient, compassionate, and reliable, with a genuine passion for supporting neurodivergent youth. If you’re dependable and eager to make a positive impact on a child’s life, we’d love to hear from you!
 
Location: Black River Falls, WI
Compensation: $17.66/hour
Schedule: Saturdays, Noon–5 PM
 
Key Responsibilities
• Provide one-on-one, safety-focused care and supervision.
• Support emotional regulation with calm, consistent responses.
• Assist with personal care needs, including toileting, in a respectful and supportive way.
• Engage the child in supportive, age-appropriate activities.
• Communicate with the child using non-verbal communication styles

Ideal Candidate
• Calm, observant, and able to maintain a safe, structured setting.
• Experienced with children on the autism spectrum or with sensory needs.
• Comfortable supporting both active play and quiet moments for regulation.
• Skilled at de-escalation, redirection, and following care routines.
• Patient, compassionate, and adaptable to the child’s emotional and developmental needs.
• Strong communicator who values collaboration with the family.

Requirements
• Must pass a caregiver/criminal background check.
• Authorized to work in the U.S.
• Reliable transportation and strong attendance record.
• Experience with non-verbal communication methods preferred, but not required.

Why This Role Matters
Make a real difference by helping a child feel safe, supported, and seen. Join this family as a steady, caring presence in their child’s life and positively impact his daily experiences.

description_html:
Youth Respite Care Provider – Support a Fun-Loving Child with Autism

We are seeking a compassionate respite care provider to support a non-verbal child with autism in a comfortable home environment. This role is perfect for someone who is patient, playful, and passionate about supporting neurodivergent youth.

The ideal provider enjoys active play, is open to using light ASL (American Sign Language) to support communication, and can create a structured yet fun environment. Activities may include backyard play, pool time, sensory-friendly games, and more.
 
Location: Bloomer, WI - Child's residence*
Starting Wage: $14.13/hour
Schedule: Up to 10 hours/Week
 
Key Responsibilities
• Engage the child in fun, sensory-friendly activities such as bubbles, and backyard play.
• Use and understand basic light ASL, or be willing to learn.
• Supervise and support water play (pool, bath, sink play) with safety and patience.
• Respect personal space and be mindful of sensory sensitivities.
• Assist with personal care needs, including toileting, in a respectful and supportive manner.

The Ideal Candidate
• Active and agile, able to keep up with a playful child who enjoys physical activities (tossing, movement, etc.).
• Kind, patient, and playful.
• Attuned to boundaries and supportive of a child when they need space.
• Experience with autism or similar needs (preferred).

Requirements
• Must pass a caregiver/criminal background check.
• Authorized to work in the U.S.
• Reliable transportation and strong attendance record.
• Experience with non-verbal communication methods preferred, but not required.

Why This Role Matters
If you’re someone who loves empowering young people and finds joy in meaningful 1:1 support, this is a wonderful opportunity to make a lasting difference.

description_html:
Youth Respite Provider – Safety, Support & Supervision

We are seeking a reliable, creative, and compassionate respite care provider to support a child in the comfort of the provider's home. This role goes beyond basic childcare—our ideal provider will be able to step into her imaginative world, encourage new experiences, and help her feel safe and supported while having fun.
 
Pick-Up Location: Cornell, WI (In Provider Home)
Starting Wage: $17.66/hour
Schedule: Thursday & Friday Afternoons + 2 weekends a month
 
Responsibilities
• Plan and engage in fun, age-appropriate activities (In the community or your home as the provider)
• Support the child’s interests (such as Roblox, Minecraft, and video games)
• Encourage and model positive coping skills in new or potentially stressful situations
• Use creativity and imagination to interact with her “special” characters as though they are real
• Maintain a calm and reassuring demeanor, especially during moments of stress or sensory triggers

Child’s Preferences & Needs
• Likes: Roblox, Minecraft, video games
• Dislikes: Forklifts, sudden loud noises
• Triggers: Loud noises may cause panic attacks—provider must remain calm and supportive
• Important: No adult-themed conversations (e.g., politics, health care debates, etc. - Due to child's active imagination and fears)

Qualities We’re Looking For
• Active imagination and willingness to engage in creative, age appropriate play
• Enthusiastic about small achievements and everyday fun
• Encouraging and supportive—able to frame new or scary situations in a positive way
• Common sense, maturity, and professionalism
• Understanding of family’s open communication style

Requirements
• Must be LGBTQ+ friendly
• Valid driver’s license, reliable vehicle, and auto insurance
• Current First Aid/CPR certification (or willingness to obtain)
• Experience working with children with developmental disabilities preferred

Interested?
If you’re dependable, compassionate, and love creating fun, positive experiences for kids, we’d love to hear from you!

description_html:
Now Hiring: Respite Provider for Fun, Creative, and Active Child

We’re looking for an engaging, reliable, and compassionate Respite Provider to support a bright and energetic child who loves to learn, create, and explore! This position starts with working alongside Mom in the home to build a positive relationship and will grow into independent respite time where Mom can take breaks out of the home.
 
Location: Chippewa Falls - Care to take place within child's home
Schedule: Flexible — schedule to be confirmed with parent in advance
Compensation: $17.66/Hr
 
Responsibilities
• Engage the child in fun, screen-free activities such as crafts, reading, homework help, and creative projects/activities.
• Be active and hands-on — think soccer, Pokémon GO adventures, rock collecting, tinkering, and imaginative play.
• Support the child’s independence and emotional regulation in a calm, structured way.
• Work with mom closely to learn child's routine and regulation styles, developing into independent care slowly giving mom valuable respite time

About the Child
• Loves spinning flags, soccer, tinkering, building things, Pokémon, Lucas the Spider, Bluey, and Spider-Man
• May need gentle support or redirection during transitions or when preferred activities end
• Can sometimes wander off when distracted, so awareness and safety attentiveness are vital

What We’re Looking For
• High-energy, fun, and patient
• Active and outdoorsy, enjoys playing and moving around
• Calm under pressure and compassionate in all interactions
• Pet friendly

Qualifications
• Driver’s license, reliable vehicle, and auto insurance required
• Must be able to pass a caregiver/criminal background check
• Experience working with children with unique needs
• Comfort with giving gentle hygiene reminders
• Patient, fun, and loving attitude toward children

Interested?
If you’re dependable, compassionate, and love creating fun, positive experiences for kids, we’d love to hear from you!

description_html:
Respite Provider Needed for Creative Teen
We are seeking a compassionate, enthusiastic respite provider to support a creative, artsy teenager who enjoys spending time in the community and connecting through shared interests. She prefers relaxed, creative, or exploratory outings. Like many teens, she can be moody at times, but generally does well with providers who are patient, respectful, and able to meet her where she’s at.
 
Location: Eau Claire - Out in the Community, In-home care may be considered later once a strong, comfortable provider relationship is established.
Schedule: Flexible Weekends/Afternoons - Up to 12Hr/Month
Compensation: $14.13/Hour
 
What We’re Looking For in a Provider:
• Someone enthusiastic, creative, and able to engage at the teen’s level
• Comfortable participating in creative activities without taking over
• Able to support healthy independence (encouraging self-validation)
• Patient, respectful, and emotionally aware
• Supportive and affirming, especially regarding LGBTQ+ topics
• Some awareness or understanding of self-harm (no active behaviors, just awareness needed)

About the Child:
The client is a creative, expressive teen who loves:
• Baking and creative cooking projects
• Painting, crafts, drawing, and making fake nail sets
• Artsy and creative outlets
• Cartoons and anime
• Music and singing
• Spending time out and about — walking downtown, going to the mall, listening to music, and “doing teenager things”
• Animals (cat cafés are a big hit!)

Requirements:
• Valid driver’s license
• Reliable vehicle
• Auto insurance
• Comfortable transporting the teen in to the community
• Prior experience working with teens is preferred

Interested?
This is a great opportunity for someone who enjoys creativity, meaningful connection, and supporting teens in building confidence and independence in a fun, low-pressure way.

description_html:
Respite Care Provider Needed – Afternoons (Mon/Wed) | $14.13/hr

We are seeking a compassionate, creative, and dependable respite care provider to support a young child with special needs in his home during weekday afternoons, with the opportunity to build hours with occasional overnights on the weekends.
 
Schedule & Pay-
• Mondays & Wednesdays: 3:00–6:00PM
• Opportunity to build additional hours, occasional overnights at 207$/Overnight
• Hourly Pay: $14.13 per hour
 
About The Child-
The kiddo is an active, and joyful child who thrives on hands-on learning and sensory-rich experiences. He is non-verbal, communicates through an AAC device and by guiding others to what he wants. he responds best to patient redirection, creativity, and distraction. He loves:
• Machines of all kinds (tractors, riding devices, wheels)
• Tinkering and cause-and-effect activities (Busy boards, buttons, etc.)
• Music, especially playing on a piano/keyboard
• Sensory play like swinging, trampoline time, swimming, and outdoor activities
• Occasional outings such as the children’s museum or outdoor adventures

Responsibilities-
• Prepare and assist with feeding
• Engage the child in sensory, art, physical, and creative activities
• Support communication using his AAC device and non-verbal cues
• Accompany the child on occasional outings and assist with activities/safety supervision as needed
• Provide care in the child’s home

What We’re Looking For-
• A provider who prioritizes safety, companionship, and fun
• Someone compassionate, patient, and understanding
• Creative and hands-on, with interest in sensory play and cause-and-effect learning
• Trustworthy, reliable, and consistent
• Experience with non-verbal children or developmental differences is a plus, but not required

Requirements-
• Must pass a caregiver/criminal background check.
• Authorized to work in the U.S.
• Reliable transportation.

If you enjoy being active, building creative activities, and forming meaningful connections, this could be a wonderful fit.

description_html:
Respite Care Provider Needed | $14.13/Hr
We are seeking a patient, kind, and emotionally supportive respite provider for a young girl in Eau Claire. She would benefit greatly from one-on-one connection with a trusted adult who can serve as a positive role model and friend outside of her parents. She is currently working toward greater independence and values having someone she can talk to/have fun with openly.

The ideal provider will be calm, consistent, and able to set gentle but firm boundaries while offering encouragement and praise.

Location: Provider’s home and community-based settings (potential for building hours with overnights)
Schedule: Flexible and to be planned in advance with provider  - Open Scheduling for: Tues, Thurs, Fri afternoons and Weekends
Compensation: $14.13/Hour
 
Ideal Provider Qualities:
• Not easily frustrated or reactive
• Understands that the child may test limits to see what she can get away with
• Able to provide firm but compassionate boundaries
• Enjoys engaging in fun activities and conversation

Child’s Personality & Interests:
• Very intelligent, witty, and curious
• Enjoys learning, structured activities, and predictable routines
• Ice cream
• Toys and imaginative play, reading, cooking
• Indoor and outdoor activities (always open to trying new things)
• She has an Action City Fun Pass, which can be used for community outings.
• She thrives with:
o Strong adults who provide direction
o Positive reinforcement and encouragement
o One-on-one attention

Areas of Focus:
• Building a trusting relationship through shared interests and consistency
• Encouraging independence while keeping expectations small and achievable
• Supporting emotional regulation and self-confidence
• Hygiene reminders/assistance may be needed if care extends to overnights
• Helping her navigate frustration and disappointment in a supportive way

Requirements:
• Valid driver’s license/Reliable vehicle/Auto insurance
• Comfortable having care within the respite provider's home
• Ability to Pass a Caregiver/Criminal Background Check

description_html:
We are seeking a compassionate, energetic, and patient individual to provide respite care for two active siblings who need supervision and support to ensure their safety and well-being. The ideal candidate will be able to manage a fast-paced environment, de-escalate conflicts, and provide positive guidance to the children as they navigate their relationships.

Care Provided in the Children’s Home
Schedule:
• 40 hours per month - Both boys (Mostly weekends and after-school care)
• 5 hours per week - Individual (Less frequent)
• Flexible schedule to be planned in advance with the managing party
Pay: $16.00 per hour

Key Responsibilities:
• Supervise and engage the siblings, ensuring a safe and nurturing environment
• Facilitate activities to promote positive interactions and minimize conflicts
• De-escalate disputes and ensure safety during challenging situations
• Support the children’s physical and emotional well-being, offering encouragement when needed
• Foster cooperative behavior and healthy communication between the children
• Provide feedback to the family on progress, behavior, and incidents during the shift
• Assist with light household duties, such as meal prep or tidying up after activities

Qualifications:
• Experience in childcare, respite care, or working with children with behavioral challenges preferred
• Ability to manage high-energy situations and resolve conflicts calmly and effectively
• Strong communication and problem-solving skills
• Ability to build trust with the children and their family
• First Aid and CPR certification (or willingness to obtain)
• Caring, empathetic nature with a strong desire to positively impact children's lives

Physical Requirements:
• Ability to engage in active play and ensure the children’s safety during physical activities
• Ability to pass a caregiver/criminal background check
• Authorized to work in the U.S.

description_html:
We are seeking a caring, patient, and dependable part-time Respite Provider to provide supervision, companionship, and support for an active, fun, and engaging young child. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys working with children, building positive relationships, and encouraging independence in a safe and supportive environment. Care will take place primarily in the child’s home, with opportunities for involvement in the local community.
 
Location: Child’s home and community-based settings
Schedule: Flexible and to be planned in advance with provider  - Open Scheduling for: After school and weekends (Up to 15 Hr/Week)
Compensation: $14.13/Hour
 
Ideal Provider Qualities:
• Enjoys engaging with children through play and creative activities
• Understands the importance of safety and close supervision
• Can remain calm, attentive, and responsive in a variety of situations
• Values building a positive and supportive relationship with both the child and family

Child’s Personality & Interests:
The child is energetic, creative, and enjoys hands-on and interactive activities. Favorite interests include:
• Playing video games
• Completing puzzles
• Spending time outdoors
• Arts and crafts projects that encourage creativity and self-expression

A successful provider will use these interests to create engaging, fun, and structured respite time while maintaining safety and consistency.

Areas of Focus:
The Respite Provider will support the child by offering supervision, engagement, and meaningful activities during respite/childcare hours. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
• Provide constant and attentive supervision to ensure the child’s safety at all times
• Experience with or understanding of elopement behaviors is strongly preferred
• Build a positive, trusting relationship and serve as a supportive role model
• Encourage age-appropriate independence through structured activities and gentle guidance
• Support social interaction, communication, and emotional expression in a patient and understanding manner
• Assist with basic personal care needs if an accident occurs
• Provide support in a respectful, calm, and reassuring way
• Communicate clearly with parents regarding activities, behaviors, and any concerns

Requirements:
• Valid driver’s license/Reliable vehicle/Auto insurance
• Comfortable having care within the child's home
• Ability to Pass a Caregiver/Criminal Background Check

description_html:
Youth Respite Provider – Focused on Safety, Regulation & Support

We are seeking a compassionate and attentive Youth Respite Provider to work with a vibrant young boy with autism in the Menomonie area. This role focuses on providing one-on-one support that promotes emotional regulation, ensures safety, and fosters a structured yet nurturing environment.

The ideal candidate will be calm, proactive, and committed to helping the child thrive through consistent routines and gentle guidance.
 
Location: Menomonie *Child's residence*
Compensation: $17.66/Hour
Flexible schedule: Scheduled in advance with parent — afternoons and weekend availability preferred.
 
Key Responsibilities:
• Provide one-on-one safety-focused care and constant supervision during all indoor and outdoor activities.
• Help the child navigate emotional regulation, offering calm, consistent responses to dysregulation or behavioral challenges.
• Engage the child in supportive and age-appropriate activities such as walks, movement games, and quiet time.
• Maintain open communication with the parents.

Ideal Candidate Will Be:
• Calm, observant, and capable of maintaining a safe and structured setting
• Experienced in working with children on the autism spectrum or with sensory needs
• Comfortable assisting with both active play and quiet moments of regulation
• Skilled at de-escalation, redirection, and following care routines
• Patient, compassionate, and flexible in adapting to the child’s care needs
• A great communicator who values teamwork with the family

Requirements:
• Must pass a caregiver/criminal background check
• Authorization to work in the U.S.
• Reliable transportation and strong attendance record

Make a real difference by helping a child feel safe, supported, and seen.
Apply today to become a steady, caring presence in this young boy’s life!

description_html:
We are looking for a fun, patient, and trustworthy individual to spend time with our energetic and curious child, providing engaging activities and giving both him and our family a healthy break.

Role Focus:
• Taking him out on activities (outdoors, play, learning-based fun)
• Supporting safety, transitions, and positive behavior
• Being an encouraging, calm presence

About Him:
• Very active and loves being outside
• Plays hockey
• Fascinated by the Titanic (can share a lot of detailed knowledge!)
• Enjoys learning: science, math, sensory play, slime, coloring
• Loves cooking and helping in the kitchen
• Big on imaginary play and storytelling
• Enjoys construction equipment (especially excavators)
• Loves water-based activities
• Does well with other people and in public settings
• Transitions can be challenging, so creativity and strategy are important when it’s time to leave activities

What Works Best:
• Calm communication (he does not respond well to yelling or harsh “no’s”)
• Clear expectations, patience, and flexibility
• Someone who enjoys staying active and engaged

Ideal Candidate:
• Flexible, patient, and dependable
• Strong communicator
• Fun, active, and creative
• Experience with children with special needs is a plus

This is a meaningful role for someone who enjoys building relationships, being active, and supporting a child’s growth in a positive, respectful way.

description_html:
Join Our Team as a Respite Provider in Eau Claire, WI!
Weekday Afternoons & Occasional Weekend Evenings

Are you passionate about making a positive impact on a child’s life? Do you enjoy hands-on caregiving and creating fun, supportive environments?

We’re looking for a compassionate and reliable Respite Provider to support a young boy in Eau Claire with his daily routine and adventures!

About the Role:
You’ll be an important part of his world—helping with daily care, supervising exciting outings, and sharing in his favorite hobbies like swimming, playing with his pets, and exploring the Children’s Museum. Your role is to provide safe, nurturing, and engaging support during weekday afternoons and some weekend evenings.

What You’ll Do:
• Assist with bathing, toileting, and meal prep
• Administer medications as needed
• Supervise and join in fun outings and recreational activities
• Provide attentive, compassionate interaction and support
• Create a safe, patient, and welcoming environment

What We’re Looking For:
• Someone comfortable around pets (our home is pet-friendly!)
• A kind, patient, and proactive caregiver
• Experience with behavioral challenges is a bonus, but not required!
• Experience in crisis intervention or working with individuals with behavioral challenges.
• Training in de-escalation and safe physical intervention techniques.

Requirements:
• 18 years or older
• Ability to safely intervene and prevent individuals (up to 200 lbs) from eloping or engaging in unsafe behaviors.
• Must be able to perform physical holds or restraints in accordance with training and safety protocols.
• Capable of standing, walking, and responding quickly in emergency situations.
• Valid driver’s license, auto insurance, and reliable transportation
• Ability to pass background checks
• Legally authorized to work in the United States

Compensation:
• $17.66 per hour for shifts under 8 hours
• $256.00 per day for shifts over 8 hours

Male applicants are highly encouraged to apply.

If you’re ready to make a meaningful difference and have fun doing it, we want to hear from you!

description_html:
Join a family-centered team and make a meaningful difference in the life of a young girl who loves creativity, music, and fun activities! This is a rewarding position for someone who is patient, thoughtful, and passionate about supporting children.
 
Schedule & Pay
• Overnights: 6 days per month
o Pay: $207.45 per Day
• Additional Hours: Occasionally 5 hours per week
o Pay: $14.13 per hour
 
Location
Care will take place in:
• Provider’s home
• Community settings
 
Responsibilities
• Assist with personal cares
• Meal preparation
• Provide supervision and safety
• Offer gentle reminders
 
About the Kiddo
She’s energetic, creative, and loves:
• Music and dancing
• Noncompetitive sports
• Arts and crafts
• Pop culture trivia
• Puzzles and problem-solving
 
Preferred Qualifications
• Patient and thoughtful communicator
• Familiarity with autism behaviors and supportive strategies
 
Requirements
• Must pass a caregiver background check prior to hire
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation
 
Why Join Us?
This is more than a job—it’s an opportunity to create a safe, supportive, and fun environment for a child who thrives on creativity and connection. If you enjoy engaging activities and making a positive impact, we’d love to hear from you!

 Compensation: $207.47 per day

description_html:
Respite Care Provider Needed – Help a Toddler Thrive!
  •  Location: Eau Claire, WI
  •  Pay: $17.66/hour – $256/day
  • Schedule: 8 hours/week + 2 overnight shifts/month
 
Are you a nurturing, dependable caregiver who enjoys working with toddlers and making a meaningful impact? We’re seeking a respite care provider for a sweet and curious toddler girl who loves:
  •  Interactive toys
  •  Exploring with curious eyes
  •  Engaging with people and building connections
 
This role is perfect for someone who is compassionate, detail-oriented, and comfortable with both playtime and essential care duties.
 
Your Responsibilities Will Include:

Ideal Candidate:
• Has experience with toddlers and/or medical caregiving
• Is patient, gentle, and attentive to detail
• Comfortable with medical equipment (training can be provided)
• Reliable and able to commit to a consistent schedule
• Yearly vaccinations (COVID & Flu) per family’s requirements
• Valid driver’s license
• Active auto insurance
• Reliable vehicle for transportation
• Must pass a caregiver background check
 
 
Why This Role Matters: You’ll be supporting a loving family and helping a child grow in a safe, joyful environment. Your care will provide essential relief and peace of mind while creating meaningful moments with a little one full of wonder.

•
Yearly vaccinations (COVID & Flu) per family’s requirements
•
Valid driver’s license
•
Active auto insurance
•
Reliable vehicle for transportation
•
Must pass a caregiver background check
Why This Role Matters: You’ll be supporting a loving family and helping a child grow in a safe, joyful environment. Your care will provide essential relief and peace of mind while creating meaningful moments with a little one full of wonder.

description_html:
Join Our Adventure as a Respite Provider! – Menomonie, WI
Do you love being active and making a difference? We’re looking for a Respite Provider to spend time with an amazing, lively boy who enjoys swinging at parks, swimming, playing catch, and anything involving a ball! If you’re energetic, caring, and ready to create fun experiences, this is the perfect role for you.
 
What You’ll Do
• Personal Care: Assist with toileting, bathing, and changing.
• Be a Helping Hand: Support Mom with daily routines.
• Meal Time Support: Assist with meal prep and feeding.
• Keep Things Safe & Positive: Supervise and engage with kindness and patience.
 
What We’re Looking For
• A big heart and a love for outdoor fun.
• Experience with children who have behavioral needs is a plus but not required.
• Must pass a caregiver background check.
• 18 years or older.
• Valid driver’s license, reliable vehicle, and auto insurance.
• Someone dependable, patient, and ready to make a difference.
 
Schedule & Pay
• $15-$18/hour
• Monday–Friday with occasional weekends
• At least 10 hours per week
 
 
Why This Role Matters: You’ll be a vital part of this child’s support system, helping him grow, explore, and thrive in a safe and loving environment. Your care gives the family peace of mind and the child a joyful, enriching experience.

6:00 AM – 8:00 AM

description_html:
Do you love helping people? Do you love working with youth and families? Are you compassionate, reliable and have great communication skills? Are you honest, trustworthy, patient, and a good role model? If you answered yes to the above, we would love to hear from you! Respite provider in or around the Eau Claire area! Position includes caring for two brothers and assisting their Mom!
 
Benefits: You will be working for a family that is very appreciative of what you do! You would be helping a family live their best life!
 
Hours/Desired Schedule:
• 4 hours a week to start
• Flexible scheduling
• Midafternoons on Thursday and Friday afternoons
 
Location:
• In the members home Eau Claire, WI
 
Pay: $17.60
 
Tasks
• Feeding Tube
• Lifting/ transferring
• Assisting with exercises
• Helping with wheelchairs
• Organization help
• Dressing help in the future
 
Children Like
• Disney movies
• Tv & Tablet
• Nintendo plushies
• Dogman or cat kid books
• Legos, needs assistance with those
• Minecraft/Roblox
• Pokémon cards
 
Preferred Qualifications:
• Ability to lift 60/70 pounds
• Understanding of rare genetic neurodegenerative conditions
 
Requirements:
• Willing to undergo a caregiver background check prior to hire
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation

description_html:
Respite Provider - Focus on Life Skills Development

Pay: $18.42/Hour

Location: Delafield, WI

Job Posting:
Respite Care Provider – Life Skills Development
We are seeking a compassionate, dependable individual to provide respite care for a bright, energetic young girl with autism and ADHD. This part-time role goes beyond basic supervision—it’s an opportunity to mentor and guide her as she builds confidence, independence, and practical life skills.
As a Respite Care Provider, you will work closely with the child in her home, supporting engaging routines and hands-on learning experiences that foster growth in a safe, nurturing environment.
 
Location: Care provided in the child’s home and occasional local community outings

Compensation: $18.42/hour

Schedule: Flexible, arranged in advance with parent/guardian
 
Key Responsibilities
• Provide 1:1 supervision in a safe, supportive environment.
• Assist and teach daily living skills, including light hygiene routines/reminders, meal preparation, and light household tasks.
• Support the child in gaining independence using positive reinforcement and step-by-step guidance.
• Encourage social-emotional growth through structured play, consistent routines, and engagement.
• Maintain open communication with the family to share progress and insights.

Ideal Provider
• Experience supporting children with disabilities or neurodiverse needs (autism and/or ADHD preferred).
• Strong interpersonal skills, patience, empathy, and consistency.
• Ability to follow and adapt to individualized care plan.
• Comfortable teaching and encouraging life skills in a structured, step-by-step manner.
• CPR/First Aid certification preferred or willingness to obtain.

Requirements
• Must pass a caregiver background check.
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation.
• Strong communication and time management skills.
• Experience working with children with special needs.
• Passion for working with youth and making a meaningful impact.
Why This Role Matters
If you enjoy mentoring children, fostering independence, and making a lasting impact, this position offers a rewarding opportunity to support a child’s growth and confidence through meaningful 1:1 care.

description_html:
Routine Child Respite Provider

Pay: $256/Overnight

Location: Bloomer, WI

Job Posting:
Youth Respite Provider – Focused on Safety, Regulation & Support
We are seeking a patient, active, and nurturing provider for a young elementary, high-energy child with ADHD who thrives with engaging activities and continuous sensory regulation. The child benefits from structured play, creative projects, and caregivers who can anticipate triggers and provide safety/comfort during challenging moments.
 
Schedule:
• Fridays to Sundays (planned in advance with family, up to two weekends per month)
• Pickup from home (Bloomer, WI) Friday afternoon, drop-off Sunday by 5 PM
• Care Provided within Provider's Home

Starting Wage: $256/Overnight or $17.66/Hour
 
About Child:
• Loves swimming, Roblox, video games, Paw Patrol (Marshall/Chase), playgrounds, and outdoor play
• Enjoys creating, being active, and swimming
• Sensitive to frustration, may have meltdowns, headbanging, or lashing out
• Medication administration and nighttime toileting assistance may be required

Responsibilities:
• Provide structured and creative activities that engage the child’s interests
• Assist with medication and nighttime hygiene/toileting as needed
• Monitor and manage potential meltdowns safely
• Be a strong communicator who values collaboration with the family
• Offer emotional support, redirection, and space as needed to regulate feelings

Qualifications:
• Must have a valid driver’s license, reliable vehicle, and auto insurance
• CPR/First Aid certification preferred
• Experience with children with ADHD or sensory regulation needs highly recommended
• Calm, patient, and confident in handling challenging behaviors

Interested?
If you’re dependable, compassionate, and love creating fun, positive experiences for kids, we’d love to hear from you!

description_html:
Active Child Respite Provider

Pay: $207/Overnight

Location: Bloomer, WI

Job Posting:
Youth Respite Provider - Active and Fun Focused Care
We are seeking a compassionate, patient, and experienced respite provider for a young teen with autism who is playful, creative, and independent-minded. This meaningful role focuses on one-on-one care that emphasizes emotional regulation, safety supervision, and structured support within a consistent, nurturing environment.
The ideal candidate is patient, compassionate, and flexible, with a genuine passion for supporting neurodivergent youth.
 
Schedule:
• Fridays to Sundays (planned in advance with family, two weekends per month)
• Pickup from home (Bloomer, WI) Friday afternoon, drop-off Sunday by 5 PM
• Care Provided within Provider's Home

Starting Wage: $207/Overnight or $14.13/Hour
 
 
About Child:
• Loves Pokémon, fishing, anime (One Piece), video games, cooking, and phone/tablet activities
• Enjoys swimming and creative projects
• Laid-back, social, and active
• Sensitive to loud noises or high-volume environments
• May need space and time to cool down if frustrated or “getting itchy” as the child describes
• Medication administration and nighttime hygiene/toileting assistance may be required

Responsibilities:
• Supervise and engage in hobbies and leisure activities safely
• Assist with medication and nighttime toileting as needed
• Provide emotional support during challenging moments
• Be a strong communicator who values collaboration with the family
• Maintain a safe environment

Qualifications:
• Must have a valid driver’s license, reliable vehicle, and auto insurance
• CPR/First Aid certification preferred
• Experience working with children with autism or ADHD highly recommended

Interested?
If you’re dependable, compassionate, and love creating fun, positive experiences for kids, we’d love to hear from you!
