Care Provided within Provider's Home
Starting Wage:
$207/Overnight or $14.13/Hour
About Child:
•
Loves Pokémon, fishing, anime (One Piece), video games, cooking, and phone/tablet activities
•
Enjoys swimming and creative projects
•
Laid-back, social, and active
•
Sensitive to loud noises or high-volume environments
•
May need space and time to cool down if frustrated or “getting itchy” as the child describes
•
Medication administration and nighttime hygiene/toileting assistance may be required
Responsibilities:
•
Supervise and engage in hobbies and leisure activities safely
•
Assist with medication and nighttime toileting as needed
•
Provide emotional support during challenging moments
•
Be a strong communicator who values collaboration with the family
•
Maintain a safe environment
Qualifications:
•
Must have a valid driver’s license, reliable vehicle, and auto insurance
•
CPR/First Aid certification preferred
•
Experience working with children with autism or ADHD highly recommended
Interested?
If you’re dependable, compassionate, and love creating fun, positive experiences for kids, we’d love to hear from you!

description_html:
Respite Care Provider Needed – Support a Joyful Toddler’s Journey!
 
 Location: Cornell WI

Pay: $14.13/hour – $207.45/day

Schedule: Up to 10 hours/week + 2 full days/month
 
Are you a caring, dependable individual who enjoys working with children and making a meaningful impact? We’re looking for a respite care provider to support a delightful toddler boy with Down syndrome in his home, building trust and connection through play and care.

This curious and joyful child loves:
  •  Going on walks
  •  Reading books
  • Playing with blocks and hands-on activities

Your Role Includes:
• Light housekeeping to maintain a safe and clean environment
• Assisting with toileting and personal care
• Preparing meals and supporting feeding routines
• Administering medications as needed
• Picking up from school once he starts school
• Providing companionship and engaging play
 
Ideal Candidate:
• Has experience with toddlers or children with disabilities (personal or professional)
• Is patient, nurturing, and reliable
• Comfortable with basic caregiving and willing to learn
• Able to build trust and connection over time
 
Why This Role Matters: You’ll be a vital part of this child’s support system, helping him grow, explore, and thrive in a safe and loving environment. Your care gives the family peace of mind and the child a joyful, enriching experience.

description_html:
Respite Provider (Part-Time)

Location: Menomonie

Compensation: $14.13 per hour + $0.70 per mile

Hours: 16-18 hours per week

Job Summary:
We are seeking a compassionate and reliable Respite Provider to support a client by providing supervision and transportation for out-of-town appointments. This part-time role requires the ability to drive long distances safely, offer attentive supervision, and assist with day-to-day needs during appointments. The ideal candidate will be punctual, caring, and able to work flexible hours.

Key Responsibilities:
• Transport the client to and from appointments located out of town, ensuring timely and safe travel.
• Provide supervision and support to the client during appointments and travel.
• Monitor the client’s well-being, ensuring their comfort and safety at all times.
• Communicate effectively with the client, family members, and healthcare providers as needed.
• Maintain a clean, organized, and safe environment during transportation and appointments.
• Record mileage for reimbursement purposes.

Qualifications:
• Must be authorized to work in the United States.
• Valid driver’s license with a clean driving record.
• Reliable vehicle suitable for long-distance travel.
• Ability to work flexible hours, including travel time.
• Previous experience in caregiving, respite care, or a related field preferred.
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
• Ability to handle unexpected situations calmly and responsibly.
• Must pass background check and provide references.
 
If you’re ready to make a meaningful difference and have fun doing it, we want to hear from you!

description_html:
Evening Caregiver Needed – Compassionate & Reliable Support (8–10 PM Shifts)

Location: Watertown, WI

Pay: $19/hour

Schedule: Daily, 8:00 PM – 10:00 PM (Pre-scheduled with alternate caregiver)
 
Are you a kind-hearted, dependable person who enjoys making a meaningful impact during calm, quiet moments?
We’re looking for an Evening Care Specialist to support a vibrant, independent individual in her private home each evening. This role is all about helping her wind down with comfort, dignity, and care during a peaceful 2-hour shift. You’ll be part of a small, supportive care team, working alongside an alternate caregiver to ensure smooth, consistent care every night.
 
What You’ll Do:
• Assist with evening personal care needs
• Complete a digital bowel program with attention to detail
• Support a relaxing bedtime routine: changing clothes, applying creams, switching from leg bag to overnight catheter
• Help set up a non-invasive ventilator
• Light housekeeping: laundry, dishes, tidying up to keep the space cozy
• Provide shower support about 3 times per week
 
About the Individual You’ll Support:
• Independent and values her autonomy
• Passionate advocate for disability and LGBTQ+ rights
• Loves humor, connection, and a positive vibe with her care team
• Appreciates caregivers who are attentive, present, and compassionate
 
The Perfect Fit:
• Experienced with personal care and evening routines
• Warm, confident, and upbeat personality
• Excellent communication skills with a great sense of humor
• Comfortable around cats (furry friends included!)
• CNA certification is a bonus, but not required
• Must have prior personal care experience
 
Requirements:
• Valid Driver’s License
• Reliable vehicle
• Current auto insurance
 
Ready to bring warmth, respect, and a little joy to someone’s evening routine?
Apply now and become an essential part of a caring team that values kindness, reliability, and a positive attitude. Let’s make every evening a smooth, comforting experience — with care and maybe even a few laughs along the way!

description_html:
Are you looking for a job where you can have a Flexible Schedule, Positive Work Environment, and get paid to have FUN?
This is the position for you. 
 
We are seeking a Respite Worker to provide respite for a 12-year-old little girl in Edgar, WI. 
This girl loves reading, writing, art and crafts, going to the YMCA, going out in the community, and learning new things.
 
Respite care will be conducted in the kid's home. Community outings are also encouraged.
 
WAGE
• $14.13 per hour (less than 8 hours)
• $207.45 per day (more than 8 hours)
 
Location: Edgar, WI
 
SCHEDULE
• 10 hours a week
• 2 days a month
• Flexible Schedule to be determined by family.
  
Tasks:
• Supervision and Safety
• Active attentiveness
• Willing to assist with daily routine (daily hygiene reminders/ assistance) 
• Companionship and Social Engagement
• Engage with clients and encourage appropriate behaviors.
• Provide transportation to/from activities
 
JOB REQUIREMENTS
• Authorized to work in the U.S.
• Criminal/Caregiver background check.
• Valid driver's license, reliable transportation, and auto insurance preferred.
• Compassionate individuals with childcare or respite care experience preferred.
• Experience with children with mental health and/or development disability preferred.
• Females encouraged to apply.

description_html:
Job Opportunity: Respite Provider for Two Awesome Brothers (Individualized Support)

Location: Eau Claire, WI

Pay: $17.66/hour

Hours: ~25–30 hours/week total | Flexible afternoons, occasional full days, and potential overnights in the provider’s home

Are you compassionate, reliable, and ready to make a real difference? We’re looking for an upbeat, hands-on Respite Provider to support two wonderful brothers—each with their own strengths, interests, and personalities. This role offers flexibility, variety, and the chance to build meaningful connections through one-on-one support.
Note: Care will be provided both separately and together, depending on the day.
 
Active and Outdoorsy Brother

About Him:
He’s an energetic, athletic kid who loves being outside—riding bikes, zipping around on scooters, and playing football, soccer, and other sports. Indoors, he enjoys video games (with limited screen time) and hanging out with someone who can keep up with his fun, active spirit.

Care Details:
• Hours: 10–15 per week

• Schedule: Flexible weekday afternoons (around 3:45 PM)

• Location: Provider’s home and/or out in the community

• Rate: $17.66/hour

• Overnights: Potential for occasional overnights in the provider’s home

Who Thrives in This Role:
• Energetic, outdoorsy, and playful
• Patient, reliable, and safety-minded
• Someone who loves staying active and engaged
 
Creative and Imaginative Brother

About Him:
He’s a bright, imaginative child who loves parks, dinosaurs, cars, swimming, coloring, and cozy movie time. He may need some assistance with personal cares—details will be explained during the interview.

Care Details:
• Hours: ~15 per week

• Schedule: Weekday afternoons after school/daycare (flexible)

• Rate: $17.66/hour

• Overnights: Occasional overnights in the provider’s home may be available

Who Thrives in This Role:
• Caring, patient, and imaginative
• Enjoys creative play and gentle structure
• Comfortable assisting with personal care tasks (training provided)

We’re looking for an upbeat, hands-on Respite Provider to support two wonderful brothers—each with their own strengths, interests, and personalities. This role offers flexibility, variety, and the chance to build meaningful connections through one-on-one support.
Note: Care will be provided both separately and together, depending on the day.
Active and Outdoorsy Brother
About Him:
He’s an energetic, athletic kid who loves being outside—riding bikes, zipping around on scooters, and playing football, soccer, and other sports. Indoors, he enjoys video games (with limited screen time) and hanging out with someone who can keep up with his fun, active spirit.
Care Details:
•
Hours:
10–15 per week
•
Schedule:
Flexible weekday afternoons (around 3:45 PM)
•
Location:
Provider’s home and/or out in the community
•
Rate:
$17.66/hour
•
Overnights:
Potential for occasional overnights in the provider’s home
Who Thrives in This Role:
•
Energetic, outdoorsy, and playful
•
Patient, reliable, and safety-minded
•
Someone who loves staying active and engaged
Creative and Imaginative Brother
About Him:
He’s a bright, imaginative child who loves parks, dinosaurs, cars, swimming, coloring, and cozy movie time. He may need some assistance with personal cares—details will be explained during the interview.
Care Details:
•
Hours:
~15 per week
•
Schedule:
Weekday afternoons after school/daycare (flexible)
•
Rate:
$17.66/hour
•
Overnights:
Occasional overnights in the provider’s home may be available
Who Thrives in This Role:
•
Caring, patient, and imaginative
•
Enjoys creative play and gentle structure
•
Comfortable assisting with personal care tasks (training provided)

description_html:
Respite Provider / Personal Support Worker

Location: Menomonie, WI Area
Pay: $14.13/ Hour or $207.45/ Day (8+ Hours)
 
We are seeking a caring, hands-on Respite Provider to support a fun-loving and social child who enjoys staying active, learning new skills, and spending time outdoors. This role is ideal for someone who is patient, energetic, and enjoys working closely with children in a family-centered environment.
 
What Support Looks Like
The Respite Provider will support the child in a variety of daily and recreational activities, including:
  • Playing while encouraging mobility and movement
  • Outdoor and summer activities such as:
      • Yard play
      • Biking
      • Swimming
      • Supporting fine motor skill development through hands-on activities like:
      • Folding clothes
      • Making cookies
      • Educational games and tasks
  • Assisting with bathroom routines, including potty training and hand washing
  • Helping the child make choices using a simple communication device
  • Training provided by parent
  • Attending and assisting with:
      • Therapy appointments (St. Croix Therapy, Horse Therapy at Trinity)
      • Occasional Rochester appointments
  • Family activities and outings
  • Providing transportation support (drop-off/pick-up for therapy and occasional park visits)
  • Transportation is paid through a transport company

Interests
  • Playing with balls and trucks
  • Biking and playing outside
  • Swimming
  • Using lots of words and engaging socially

Important Things to Know
  • Prefers not to go backward in a wheelchair
  • Sensitive to crying or screaming
  • Does not like slime or cold items

Schedule & Hours
  • School Year:
      • 40 hours/month (S5125 Personal Supports)
      • Respite: 5 days/month (daily rate only)
  • Summer:
      • 50 hours/month
      • Respite: 6 days/month (daily rate only)

Ideal Candidate
  • Patient, reliable, and compassionate
  • Enjoys working with children and being active
  • Comfortable assisting with personal care routines
  • Willing to learn and follow family-guided support strategies
  • Dependable and comfortable assisting with appointments and outings

Do You Love Helping Others?

We are looking for a compassionate, reliable, and patient individual with strong communication skills. If you are honest, trustworthy, and a positive role model, we would love to hear from you!
 
We are seeking a Respite Care Provider to support a young boy in his home by providing supervision, assistance with daily needs, and engaging activities.
 
Benefits

description_html:
Respite Care Provider (Part-Time)

Location: Bloomer, WI
Hours: Approximately 6 hours per week (flexible, as needed)
Pay Rate: $14.13 per hour

Position Overview
We are seeking a reliable, patient, and caring Respite Care Provider to offer part-time support when additional help is needed. The role involves providing a calm, safe, and engaging environment at home and occasionally in the community.

The ideal candidate will be comfortable supporting an individual who experiences daily seizures and will provide a steady, reassuring presence while following an established Seizure Action Plan.

Responsibilities
  • Provide attentive one-on-one care in the home and occasionally in the community
  • Engage in preferred activities, including:
  • Using a tablet
  • Reading books
  • Playing with toys, board games, or card games
  • Outdoor play during warm weather
  • Monitor for seizure activity and respond appropriately according to the Seizure Action Plan
  • Provide gentle reminders for bathroom use, as delaying may trigger seizures
  • Maintain a calm, predictable environment with slow, clear communication
  • Offer reassurance and support during moments of frustration or feeling overwhelmed

Seizure Awareness & Care
  • Seizures occur daily and may include:
  • Head turning to the side
  • Eye twitching
  • Dizziness
  • The individual is aware that seizures may occur
  • The provider must remain calm and confident during seizure activity
  • Experience with seizure care is preferred

Qualifications
  • Experience working with individuals who have seizures or complex medical needs
  • Patient, dependable, and understanding
  • Comfortable maintaining routines and a calm pace
  • Able to follow care plans consistently

description_html:
Part-Time / Back-Up Support Provider

Location: Child’s Home & Community Activities
Pay: $14.13/hour + $0.70/mile (when the child is in your vehicle)
 
About the Role:
We’re looking for a calm, patient, and reliable support provider to spend time with a thoughtful, outdoors-loving young boy. He enjoys quiet connection, gentle communication, and being outside.

This role is ideal for someone who is soft-spoken, respectful of personal space, and comfortable supporting sensory needs. You’ll assist with light meal prep, accompany him during meals, and engage in enjoyable daily activities at home and in the community.
 
Responsibilities:
• Provide part-time and/or back-up support as needed
• Spend time with him at home and in the community, engaging in activities he enjoys (especially outdoors)
• Assist with light meal preparation and sit with him during meals
• Maintain a calm environment and use soft-spoken communication
• Support sensory needs, including use of sensory equipment
• Respect personal space and allow extra processing time for tasks
• Learn and follow care routines, including how to manage and replace his G-Button (training provided)
• Be attentive to asthma symptoms and administer inhaler as needed (training provided)

About You:
• Calm, patient, and gentle in communication
• Comfortable supporting sensory sensitivities (lighting, textures, quiet environments)
• Reliable, flexible, and able to step in for back-up shifts
• Comfortable learning new care routines and equipment
• Enjoys spending time outdoors
• Experience with disability support or caregiving is a plus, but not required.

If you’re someone who values calm connection, respects sensory needs, and enjoys making a meaningful difference in a child’s daily life, we’d love to hear from you!

description_html:
Evening Caregiver Needed – Compassionate & Reliable Support

Location: Watertown, WI
Pay: $19/hour
Schedule: Daily, 8:00 PM – 10:00 PM (Pre-scheduled with alternate caregiver)
 
Are you a kind-hearted, dependable person who enjoys making a meaningful impact during calm, quiet moments?

We’re looking for an Evening Care Specialist to support a vibrant, independent individual in her private home each evening. This role is all about helping her wind down with comfort, dignity, and care during a peaceful 2-hour shift. You’ll be part of a small, supportive care team, working alongside an alternate caregiver to ensure smooth, consistent care every night.
 
What You’ll Do:
• Assist with evening personal care needs
• Complete a digital bowel program with attention to detail
• Support a relaxing bedtime routine: changing clothes, applying creams, switching from leg bag to overnight catheter
• Help set up a non-invasive ventilator
• Light housekeeping: laundry, dishes, tidying up to keep the space cozy
• Provide shower support about 3 times per week
 
About the Individual You’ll Support:
• Independent and values her autonomy
• Passionate advocate for disability and LGBTQ+ rights
• Loves humor, connection, and a positive vibe with her care team
• Appreciates caregivers who are attentive, present, and compassionate
 
The Perfect Fit:
• Experienced with personal care and evening routines
• Warm, confident, and upbeat personality
• Excellent communication skills with a great sense of humor
• Comfortable around cats (furry friends included!)
• CNA certification is a bonus, but not required
• Must have prior personal care experience
 
Requirements:
• Valid Driver’s License
• Reliable vehicle
• Current auto insurance
 
Ready to bring warmth, respect, and a little joy to someone’s evening routine?
Apply now and become an essential part of a caring team that values kindness, reliability, and a positive attitude. Let’s make every evening a smooth, comforting experience — with care and maybe even a few laughs along the way!

description_html:
Hours: 4–6 hours per week
Rate of Pay: $14.13/hour
Schedule: 1–2 days per week, preferably Fridays; after-school hours

About the Role
We are seeking a reliable, active, and patient Respite Provider to support a young person in the Elk Mound area. This position involves after-school pickup and spending 1–2 hours together engaging in meaningful, enjoyable activities. The goal is to provide a supportive, calm, and structured environment.

Responsibilities:
• Pick up from school and provide supervision for 1–2 hours after school
• Engage in hands-on, active, or creative activities based on his interests
• Participate in outdoor activities such as biking, fishing, or using the YMCA pass
• Provide a structured, calm environment with low sensory overload

About Him
Interests:
• Very athletic; enjoys physical activity and “work”-type tasks
• Hands-on activities, arts and crafts, building projects
• Outdoorsy—BMX biking, fishing, exploring
• Has a family YMCA membership
• Curious and currently very interested in Mexican culture

Dislikes / Sensitivities:
• Big crowds, loud/noisy environments, or chaotic spaces
• Certain foods (specifics can be discussed during onboarding)

What We’re Looking For:
• Someone dependable, calm, and patient
• Knowledgeable about the outdoors, sports, and hands-on activities
• Familiarity with or interest in Mexican culture is a plus
• Experience working with youth or respite care is helpful but not required

description_html:
Overnight Caregiver (CNA or Nursing Student Preferred)

Location: Alma Center, WI
Pay: $17.66/hour — Daily rate: $256 per day (8–24 hours)
Schedule: 8:00 PM – 6:00 AM, 3–4 nights per week

About the Role
We are seeking a caring, patient, and dependable Overnight Caregiver to provide hands-on, attentive assistance for a young man with significant physical care needs. The ideal candidate is compassionate, adaptable, and detail-oriented — someone who values helping others live comfortably and safely at home.

This position is an excellent opportunity for a Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) or Nursing Student looking to gain meaningful experience in direct patient care.
Primary Responsibilities

Provide maximal assistance with:
• Administering medications (3x per day)
• Dressing, eating, and drinking (assisting with refilling water bottle with extended straw as needed)
• Sponge bathing and personal hygiene
• Transfers to and from manual wheelchair (using a Hoyer lift)
• Repositioning every 2–4 hours to prevent pressure injuries
• Straight catheterization (6x per day: every 4 hours during the day, every 6 hours overnight)
• Nightly bowel program, including transfer to bowel chair (currently performed in bed)
• Monitoring for autonomic dysreflexia (e.g., headache) and responding appropriately
• Monitoring skin integrity (checking twice daily for redness or irritation from braces, shoes, or clothing)
• Providing comfort and companionship — he enjoys movies, music, and spending time on his phone

Qualifications
• Experience providing physical cares, transfers, and mobility assistance required
• Experience with catheterization, bowel programs, and Hoyer lifts preferred
• Compassionate, patient, and reliable
• Ability to adapt to changing needs and maintain attention to detail
• Driver’s license

Experience with catheterization, bowel programs, and Hoyer lifts preferred
•
Compassionate, patient, and reliable
•
Ability to adapt to changing needs and maintain attention to detail
•
Driver’s license

description_html:
Location: Provider’s Home & Community Outings
Pay: $14.13/hour or $207.45/day

Are you energetic, caring, and ready to make a positive impact? We’re looking for an outgoing Respite Provider to support a fun, high-energy boy who’s equal parts athletic and nerdy. If you love wrestling, football, gaming, WWE—or just keeping up with an active kid who’s full of personality—this could be the perfect fit!

What You’ll Do
  • Provide approximately 8 hours per month + 2 full days per month of respite care
  • Engage in a mix of at-home activities and community adventures
  • Included perks: Passes to the YMCA and Children’s Museum
  • Participate in active play—sports, games, outdoor fun, and anything that keeps him moving
  • Offer calm, patient, positive support, using encouraging behavior techniques
  • Help him practice emotional regulation and use coping strategies during tough moments

About You
  • Energetic, patient, compassionate, and ready to engage
  • Comfortable providing care in your home
  • Reliable communicator who values consistency
  • Experience with ADHD or trauma-informed care is a bonus (but not required!)

description_html:
CNA / Personal Care Worker (PCW)

Location: Eleva, Wisconsin
Pay: $17.66 per hour

Make a meaningful difference in someone’s life while working in a calm, supportive home environment. We’re seeking two compassionate and dependable caregivers to provide essential one-on-one care for a family in need.
 
Available Schedules (Two Positions)

Caregiver #1
• Monday, Wednesday & Friday
• 9:00 AM–2:00 PM or 10:00 AM–3:00 PM

Caregiver #2
• Tuesday & Thursday
• 9:00 AM–2:00 PM or 10:00 AM–3:00 PM

(Flexibility with start/end times is a plus.)
 
What You’ll Do
• Provide gentle assistance with bathing and personal care
• Support safe repositioning as needed
• Prepare simple meals and assist with light daily living tasks
• Follow established family routines to ensure comfort and consistency
 
What We’re Looking For
• CNA or PCW experience preferred
• Caring, responsible, and detail-oriented individuals
• Ability to work independently while maintaining a warm, respectful approach
 
Requirements
• Authorization to work in the U.S.
• Clear criminal and caregiver background checks
• Valid driver’s license
• Experience with caregiving or supporting individuals with special needs is a plus

description_html:
Location: Chippewa Falls, WI
Schedule: Approximately 8 hours per week (weekdays after 5:00 PM and/or weekends)
Pay: $14.13 per hour
 
Job Description
We are seeking a kind, patient, and reliable Respite Provider to spend time with a sweet and lovable child in their home. This role is designed to give the primary caregivers a short break while ensuring the child feels safe, supported, and engaged.

The ideal candidate will enjoy calm, gentle interactions and be comfortable providing both companionship and personal care in a nurturing environment.
 
Responsibilities
• Engage in age-appropriate, enjoyable activities such as playing with bubbles, listening to music, and watching kid-friendly shows
• Provide personal cares as needed
• Maintain a safe, calm, and comforting environment
• Offer emotional support and reassurance, especially during moments of frustration or upset
• Be attentive to the child’s needs, preferences, and triggers, including avoiding loud noises and other sources of distress
• Communicate regularly with parents regarding the child’s needs and well-being
 
Qualifications
• Previous experience with childcare, babysitting, or respite care preferred
• Patient, gentle, and compassionate demeanor
• Comfortable providing personal cares
• Reliable, punctual, and trustworthy
• Ability to understand and respond to the child’s needs, including navigating communication barriers

description_html:
Now Hiring: Respite Provider in Eau Claire, WI!
Pay Rate: $14.13/hour
Hours: 8 per week

Are you energetic, dependable, and love spending time with kids? We’re searching for a fun, active Respite Provider to support an adventurous, elementary-aged boy in Eau Claire. If you enjoy getting out into the community, staying active, and making a difference, this role is for you!

About the Role
You’ll get to spend your time doing things he loves—including:
• Heading out for exciting community outings (he even has an Action City pass!)
• Playing games together—yes, video games count as bonding time!
• Enjoying outdoor activities, parks, and anything that keeps you both moving
• Creating a safe, positive, and encouraging environment

We’re Looking for Someone Who Is:
• Responsible, reliable, and upbeat
• Ready to engage in both indoor fun and outdoor adventures
• Patient, supportive, and comfortable connecting with kids of different energy levels

Why You’ll Love This Job
• Flexible, low-hour commitment—perfect for students, part-time workers, or anyone seeking meaningful work
• A chance to make a real, positive impact while having fun
• Every shift is a mix of activity, connection, and creativity

description_html:
Location: Eau Claire, WI (In the community / providers home)
Schedule: 6 hours per week (Tuesdays, Thursdays, or Fridays available) + 2 days per month (8-hour days to start, transitioning to overnight shifts once comfortable)
Pay Rate:
• Hourly: $17.66/hour
• Day/Overnight Rate: $256.00 per day
 
Position Overview
We are seeking a compassionate, patient, and engaging Respite Provider to support an individual in the community by helping him build social skills and participate in fun, meaningful activities. This role involves providing supervision, encouragement, and guidance during community outings and home activities.

The ideal candidate enjoys being active, creative, and flexible, and can maintain a calm, supportive approach when managing challenging behaviors such as verbal aggression.
 
Responsibilities
  • Provide community-based respite care and social support.
  • Encourage and model positive social interactions.
  • Engage in preferred activities, including:
  • Riding bikes, playing catch, and basketball
  • Music and drumming
  • Arts and crafts
  • Swimming
  • Visiting Action City, Reboot Social, and bowling
  • Helping with cooking and baking activities
  • Ensure safety during all activities and outings.
  • Communicate effectively with family or support staff regarding progress and daily activities.
 
Qualifications
  • Experience working with individuals with behavioral or social challenges preferred.
  • Patience, empathy, and strong communication skills.
  • Ability to manage verbal aggression with calm and professionalism.
  • Reliable transportation for community outings.

description_html:
Are you compassionate, reliable, and have great communication skills? Do you love helping people? Do you love working with youth and families?

If you answered yes to the above, we would love to hear from you! This position is for a young girl. More details about kiddo are discussed during the interview!
 
Benefits: You will be working for a family that is very appreciative of what you do! You would be helping a family live their best life!  
 
Hours/Desired Schedule:
• 10 hours a week 
• After School Tuesdays, Thursday & Fridays
 
Pay: $17.66/hour
Location: In the community, providers home
 
Kiddo Likes:
• Animals
• Swimming
• Puzzles
• Crafting
• Watching movies
• Being outside

Job Responsibilities:
• Meal Prep
• Medication Management, monitor that she does take them
• Reminders for tasks
• Keep very close eyes on her with people and meals
• Outings to park/community
 
Preferred Qualifications:
• Patient & Thoughtful in Speech and communication
• Active and outgoing personality
 
Job Specific Requirements*:
• Willing to undergo a caregiver background check prior to hire 
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation

description_html:
Evening Caregiver Needed – Compassionate & Reliable Support

Location: Watertown, WI
Pay: $19/hour
Schedule: Daily, 8:00 PM – 10:00 PM (Pre-scheduled with alternate caregiver)
 
Are you a kind-hearted, dependable person who enjoys making a meaningful impact during calm, quiet moments?

We’re looking for an Evening Care Specialist to support a vibrant, independent individual in her private home each evening. This role is all about helping her wind down with comfort, dignity, and care during a peaceful 2-hour shift. You’ll be part of a small, supportive care team, working alongside an alternate caregiver to ensure smooth, consistent care every night.
 
What You’ll Do:
• Assist with evening personal care needs
• Complete a digital bowel program with attention to detail
• Support a relaxing bedtime routine: changing clothes, applying creams, switching from leg bag to overnight catheter
• Help set up a non-invasive ventilator
• Light housekeeping: laundry, dishes, tidying up to keep the space cozy
• Provide shower support about 3 times per week
 
About the Individual You’ll Support:
• Independent and values her autonomy
• Passionate advocate for disability and LGBTQ+ rights
• Loves humor, connection, and a positive vibe with her care team
• Appreciates caregivers who are attentive, present, and compassionate
 
The Perfect Fit:
• Experienced with personal care and evening routines
• Warm, confident, and upbeat personality
• Excellent communication skills with a great sense of humor
• Comfortable around cats (furry friends included!)
• CNA certification is a bonus, but not required
• Must have prior personal care experience
 
Requirements:
• Valid Driver’s License
• Reliable vehicle
• Current auto insurance
 
Ready to bring warmth, respect, and a little joy to someone’s evening routine?
Apply now and become an essential part of a caring team that values kindness, reliability, and a positive attitude. Let’s make every evening a smooth, comforting experience — with care and maybe even a few laughs along the way!

description_html:
We are seeking a reliable and patient Transportation Provider to assist an adult male member with daily transportation to and from designated pickup and drop-off points. This role involves short, scheduled travel times, ensuring safety, and providing minimal assistance as needed. This man is friendly and cooperative with a consistent routine.
 
Location: Eagle River, WI
 
Schedule:
• Days: Monday-Thursday
• Morning Drop-Off: Arrive at the member's home at 7:15AM and transport the member to the designated drop-off point.
• Afternoon Pick-Up: Return to the drop-off point at 4:50PM and transport the member back home.
 
Wage:
• $16.32-$18.48 per hour
• Mileage Reimbursement: Eligible for both loaded and unloaded mileage reimbursement.

Position Responsibilities
• Provide punctual and dependable transportation based on the schedule.
• Ensure member safety during all transport.
• Assist the member with buckling his seatbelt, as he needs help fastening it at times.
• Maintain a clean and safe vehicle.
• Demonstrate patience, professionalism, and clear communication.
• Follow all traffic laws and agency safety expectations.
 
Requirements
• Valid driver's license, reliable, insured vehicle, and clean driving record.
• Ability to consistently meet scheduled pickup and drop-off times.
• Prior caregiving or transportation experience is helpful but not required.
• Willing to undergo Criminal/Caregiver background check.

description_html:
We are looking for a caring and reliable Child Respite Provider to support two young brothers on the autism spectrum in their home. The boys are mostly non-verbal, so patience, calmness, and creativity in communication are important. They thrive with consistent routines and gentle, compassionate care.

The ideal candidate demonstrates kindness, empathy, and strong interpersonal skills. Experience working with children on the autism spectrum or those using non-verbal communication is strongly preferred.

The boys enjoy: toys, toy cars, water play, and people-watching.

Location: Weston, WI
Wage: $17.70 per hour/$259.32 per day
Shift: 80 hours per month 
               4 days per month – prefer Saturdays or Sundays

Responsibilities:
  • Care/Supervision/Companionship
  • Effective non-verbal communication strategies, visual support, or other provided tools.
  • Cares: Toileting (assistance child with wiping/clean up), Meal Prep/snacks 
  • Redirect and deescalate behaviors as needed while being patient and calm

Qualifications:
  • Valid Driver’s License, reliable vehicle, & auto insurance
  • Previous experience working with special needs children/Autism
  • Willing to undergo a background check prior to hire

description_html:
We are currently seeking a confident and reliable Housekeeper to support a wonderful woman in Plover, WI.  This woman values her independence and communicates her needs clearly. You will play an important role by helping this woman maintain the cleanliness of her home.

We're looking for someone who truly cares about making a positive difference in others’ lives and understands the importance of dignity, respect, and consistency in their work.

The ideal candidate will have the following qualities:
• Enjoys building positive, respectful relationships 
• Experience in caregiving/housekeeping 
• Compassionate, patient, and dependable
• Prefer someone who loves dogs as much as she loves her own
• Prefers a FEMALE PROVIDER

LOCATION: Plover, WI
WAGE:  $16.32 per hour
SCHEDULE: 3-hour shifts every other week. 
                            Shifts occur no earlier than 1pm and no later than 7pm.                            

TASKS: 
• Light housekeeping: kitchen, bathroom, sweep/mop/vacuum/shake rugs  

REQUIREMENTS:
• Valid Driver’s License & Reliable transportation    
• Experience with housekeeping
• Member prefers FEMALE housekeeper
• Willing to undergo a background check prior to hire

description_html:
Creative, thoughtful woman artist—retired from a career in politics focused on equality—seeks a backup/fill-in Companion Care Provider to spend time together and join her for activities a few times a week. Ideal for someone who understands dementia, values connection and independence, and brings warmth and humor to everyday interactions.
*Family prefers a FEMALE AND NON-SMOKING PROVIDER

Location: Madison, WI
Wage: $16.32 to $25.00 per hour -based on experience

Schedule:
• Part-time BACK UP/FILL IN - afternoon work (no later than 4pm)
• 2 to 5 hours per week possible. Coverage needed for provider illnesses and vacations.

Key Responsibilities:
• Provide warm, respectful, easy conversation and fun companionship both at home and in the community
• Provide continuous attentive monitoring for needs, safety, and well-being, positively redirecting when needed, while promoting independence.
• Enjoy conversations on topics of mutual interest or new topics. Explore her and your shared interests and pursue activities related to those. 
• Help her maintain her abilities and routines to support her current baseline 
• Bring a sense of calm, ease, enjoyment, and laughter to daily interactions 
• Use your vehicle to take the member on local community outings.

The Ideal Candidate Will:
• Have training and experience working with individuals living with dementia
• Be observant, patient, and respectful of boundaries
• Possess excellent communication skills and a good sense of humor 
• Be flexible and able to adapt to changing needs and routines
• Understand how to foster autonomy while providing appropriate support

This is a wonderful opportunity for someone who enjoys meaningful, one-on-one companion care and truly values making a difference in someone’s day.

This woman enjoys: Art- especially painting, doing art- pen and paper, art history, women’s and feminist art, women’s history, history, politics, political movements, gardening, flowers, walks or sitting in nature, conversations with people who have diverse interests like her. Also enjoys younger kids, and animals – dogs, cats, horses.

Tasks to be incorporated into all shifts:
• Half hour walks around the block 
• Having the woman ready aloud to you. 
• Activities at home (doing art, sewing, etc.) and/or outings: library (weekly), going to art galleries, art shows, art museums, gardens and parks, music, Wingra park walking path and sitting by the lakeshore. Errands like going to get her hair cut.
• Sometimes light cleaning.

Requirements:
• 18 years of age or older with a high school diploma or GED
• Experience working with people with dementia for at least 1 year 
• Provider references verifying personal/professional experience
• Valid Driver’s License, reliable vehicle, auto insurance(comprehensive), and a clean driving record
• Willing to do a background check
• Family prefers FEMALE caregivers and non-smokers

description_html:
MORNING & EVENING RESPITE PROVIDER – Eau Claire, WI
 
We are seeking a reliable, consistent, and patient Respite Provider to assist a bright, spirited young girl with her morning and bedtime routines. This position is perfect for someone who enjoys working with children, can set clear boundaries, and provides a calm and structured approach to daily routines. The right candidate will help create a safe, nurturing, and supportive environment that encourages cooperation, independence, and positive behavior.
 
ABOUT THE CHILD:
This young girl is full of personality, curiosity, and intelligence. She is fully capable of completing tasks independently, but can be defiant at times and likes to test boundaries. She enjoys using her tablet, but sometimes struggles with transitions and following routines. The ideal provider is firm, patient, and consistent, helping her to navigate these moments while maintaining a positive connection.

SCHEDULE & HOURS:
• 10-12 hours per week
• Morning Shift: 7:00 AM – 8:30 AM – assist with waking up, getting ready, and preparing for school
• Evening Shift: 8:00 PM – 9:00 PM – assist with bedtime routine, promoting calm and healthy sleep habits
• Flexible scheduling may be considered depending on family needs

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Provide consistent supervision during morning and evening routines
• Set and maintain clear boundaries while remaining patient and supportive
• Assist with transitions, including limiting tablet use and following instructions
• Support emotional regulation and help the child engage positively with routines
• Communicate effectively with the family regarding successes, challenges, or concerns
• Encourage independence while providing guidance and structure
• Maintain a safe and nurturing environment at all times

IDEAL CANDIDATE:
• Patient, firm, and consistent
• Experienced with children who may test boundaries or show defiant behavior
• Comfortable enforcing rules and maintaining routines in a calm, supportive manner
• Energetic, attentive, and able to connect positively with children
• Flexible and able to adjust strategies based on the child’s mood or needs

REQUIREMENTS:
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation
• Must pass a background check
• Previous experience in childcare, respite, or behavioral support preferred

ABOUT THE CHILD:
This young girl is full of personality, curiosity, and intelligence. She is fully capable of completing tasks independently, but can be defiant at times and likes to test boundaries. She enjoys using her tablet, but sometimes struggles with transitions and following routines. The ideal provider is firm, patient, and consistent, helping her to navigate these moments while maintaining a positive connection.
SCHEDULE & HOURS:
•
10-12 hours per week
•
Morning Shift: 7:00 AM – 8:30 AM – assist with waking up, getting ready, and preparing for school
•
Evening Shift: 8:00 PM – 9:00 PM – assist with bedtime routine, promoting calm and healthy sleep habits
•
Flexible scheduling may be considered depending on family needs
RESPONSIBILITIES:
•
Provide consistent supervision during morning and evening routines
•
Set and maintain clear boundaries while remaining patient and supportive
•
Assist with transitions, including limiting tablet use and following instructions
•
Support emotional regulation and help the child engage positively with routines
•
Communicate effectively with the family regarding successes, challenges, or concerns
•
Encourage independence while providing guidance and structure
•
Maintain a safe and nurturing environment at all times
IDEAL CANDIDATE:
•
Patient, firm, and consistent
•
Experienced with children who may test boundaries or show defiant behavior
•
Comfortable enforcing rules and maintaining routines in a calm, supportive manner
•
Energetic, attentive, and able to connect positively with children
•
Flexible and able to adjust strategies based on the child’s mood or needs
REQUIREMENTS:
•
Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation
•
Must pass a background check
•
Previous experience in childcare, respite, or behavioral support preferred

We are looking for a reliable, supportive, and patient provider to spend quality time with them in the community on a routine support basis.
 
ABOUT THE KIDDO:
• Enjoys going out into the community
• Loves boba tea, visiting stores, going to the CCS, and exploring fun places
• May want to include political discussions
• Would love predictability and stability

SCHEDULE & HOURS:
• 4 hours per week, mostly on weekday evenings
• Desired schedule: Monday & Wednesdays after 4PM
• On-call and flexible scheduling options - you can collaborate with the family to create a schedule that works for everyone
• Community outing coverage is a priority, but flexibility is appreciated for additional support as opportunities arise

• With Mileage Reimbursement

• Conduct community outings (boba, store, walks, community events, CCS visits)
• Provide companionship and supervision
• Help them navigate transitions and new routines
• Maintain patience and calm demeanor during moments of disagreement or frustration from kiddo
• Encourage independence with providing structure
• Build trust and communicate respectfully
• Create a safe and engaging environment during all activities outside of the home

description_html:
Respite Provider – Menomonie, WI
Pay: $17.66/hour

We are seeking an energetic, compassionate Respite Provider to work 1:1 with a young, elementary-aged boy with autism. Care will take place in the child’s home and nearby parks. He is mostly non-verbal, sensory-seeking, and thrives with routine and physical activity.

Schedule:
• 6 hours/week, Saturdays & Sundays (11am–4pm preferred)

Responsibilities:
• Provide 1:1 supervision and care in home and community
• Support sensory and play-based activities (trampoline, swings, balls, music, TV)
• Encourage communication via signs, gestures, and communication pad
• Assist with basic personal care (pull-up/restroom)
• Ensure safety, especially with elopement and outdoor play

Ideal Candidate:
• Energetic, patient, reliable, and physically able to keep up with an active child
• Experienced with autism or developmental differences
• Calm and confident in managing behaviors
• Creative in engaging the child and redirecting attention

Requirements:
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation
• 2–3 references
• Pass a background check

description_html:
We are seeking a compassionate, energetic, and experienced Respite Provider to work 1:1 with a young elementary-aged boy with autism. This is a unique opportunity to make a meaningful difference in the life of a bright and active child who loves to play, explore, and engage in sensory experiences. The care will take place primarily in the family’s home and nearby parks/locations. He is mostly non-verbal, sensory-seeking, and thrives with routine and physical activity. He communicates using signs, gestures, and a communication pad. He is sweet, curious, and full of energy—he’ll win you over with his smiles and warm hugs.
 
Pay: $17.66/hour (after tax rate)
Location: Child resides in Menomonie, WI - Respite to take place in the child's home/community
Schedule: 6 hours/week available, SAT & SUN (between 11am-4pm preferred)
 
Things He Enjoys:
• Sensory driven – Playing with balloons & soccer balls, jumping on the trampoline, swinging, sliding, etc.
• Going to the Park - Elmwood, Lakeside, Phelan are a few favorites
• TV - Peppa Pig, Pikachu, Puppy Dog Pals, Monster Truck 
• Music - Listening to gospel music
 
Key Responsibilities:
• Provide 1:1 care and supervision in the home and community
• Support with play-based and sensory activities to promote regulation and engagement
• Ensure safety, especially with elopement tendencies and during outdoor play
• Assist with basic personal care (child is not fully potty-trained)
• Encourage use of communication methods (sign language, gestures, communication pad)
• Adapt activities based on child’s interests, moods, and energy levels
• Follow daily routines and support emotional regulation
 
Ideal Candidate:
• Energetic, patient, and reliable
• Physically able to keep up with a very active child
• Calm and confident in responding to behaviors (e.g., throwing, swatting, elopement)
• Creative in using play and sensory tools to redirect and engage
• Attentive to safety, particularly with stairs, outdoor play, and transitions
• Experienced in working with children with autism or other developmental differences
 
Personal Cares:
• Restroom & Pullup assistance
 
Requirements:
• Must provide 2-3 references at the time of phone interview (prior to meeting with family)
• Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation
• Willing to undergo a caregiver background check upon hire

description_html:
We are seeking a patient, passionate, and calm caregiver to support a bright and bubbly child with unique emotional and developmental needs. This is a part-time, morning weekday-only role that requires someone reliable, nurturing, and experienced in working with children who have fears around toileting and sensory sensitivities.

SHIFTS:
o 3:15 PM - 7:15 PM, twice a week (4 hours total)
o Weekday night only
 
WAGE:
o $14.13 per hour

RESPONSIBILITIES:
o Provide calm, compassionate care and supervision for morning routine
o Assist with feeding breakfast and hydration reminders
o Support toileting and diaper changes with patience and respect
o Respond to meltdowns calmly and set clear boundaries
o Engage in favorite activities like singing (Plankton/Roblox songs) and Roblox play during time of getting ready
 
REQUIREMENTS:
o Valid Driver’s License
o Reliable Transportation
o Must pass a background check

description_html:
Are you compassionate, patient, and looking for meaningful part-time work that truly makes a difference? We’re looking for a nurturing, reliable caregiver to support a bright, bubbly child with unique emotional and developmental needs.
 
This is a weekday evening role, perfect for someone who enjoys creating calm, structured routines and helping children start their day with confidence. The ideal candidate will be someone with a gentle presence who can provide reassurance and consistency — especially for a child who experiences toileting fears and sensory sensitivities.
 
You’ll be part of a caring team that values patience, positivity, and genuine connection. If you’re someone who finds joy in helping kids grow and feel safe, we’d love to meet you!
 
SHIFTS:
o 3:15PM -7:15PM, twice a week (4 hours total)
o Weekday evenings only
 
WAGE:
o $14.13 per hour

RESPONSIBILITIES:
As an In-Home Respite Provider, you’ll play an important role in the child’s morning routine and overall comfort.
o Providing calm, compassionate care and supervision during the morning routine
o Assisting with breakfast and giving verbal prompts for hydration
o Supporting with toileting and diaper changes in a patient, respectful way
o Handling meltdowns or emotional moments with empathy and clear, consistent boundaries
o Engaging in fun activities the child enjoys — such as singing favorite songs (Plankton/Roblox soundtracks), light play, or brief Roblox sessions as part of the morning routine
o Creating a safe, structured, and positive environment where the child can feel supported and ready for the day ahead
 
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:
You’ll be a great fit for this role if you are:
o Patient, calm, and grounded — able to handle emotional or sensory challenges with empathy
o Reliable and consistent — families depend on you to show up and provide stability
o Playful and kind — able to connect through humor, music, or shared interests
o A good communicator — comfortable following directions and maintaining open communication with the family

Experience in caregiving, child care, special education, or related fields is a plus, but training and guidance will be provided for the right person with the right heart.
 
REQUIREMENTS:
o Valid Driver’s License
o Reliable Transportation
o Must pass a background check
   
WHY THIS ROLE MATTERS:
This isn’t just a short shift to make quick cash — it’s a meaningful way to make a positive impact every week for this family to make their days easier. You’ll be helping a child build confidence, comfort, and trust through small, daily moments that matter. You’ll also give parents valuable peace of mind knowing their child is safe, cared for, and supported with patience and understanding every morning.

This is a wonderful opportunity for someone who wants to work with purpose, bring joy to a child’s morning routine, and be part of a family-centered care team.

description_html:
IN YOUR HOME TEENAGE RESPITE PROVIDER  – Eau Claire, WI

We’re looking for a caring, dependable provider to support a creative, animal-loving 15-year-old who thrives with routine and gentle encouragement. She may be shy at first, but once she’s comfortable, she becomes silly, fun, and engaging. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys mentorship, meaningful connections, and helping a teen grow more confident and independent. She also follows a strict gluten-free diet, so providers must be mindful and supportive of her dietary needs. The care will take place in YOUR HOME or out and about in the community.

SHIFTS:
o 15 Hours per week
o FLEXIBLE Weekends & Occasional Weeknights
o Build your own schedule

WAGE:
o $17.66 per hour
 
WHAT THE KIDDO LOVES TO DO THAT I HOPE YOU DO TOO:
o LOVES animals (volunteers at the Kitty Cafe & Humane Society) 
o Roblox  
o Art & Being Creative – digital art 
o Board Games 
o Action City – (She has a pass & enjoys the Arcade & swimming at Chaos)  
o RESPITE WILL BE DONE IN THE PROVIDERS HOME/COMMUNITY
 
REQUIREMENTS:
o Valid Driver’s License
o Reliable Transportation
o Must pass a background check

o Able to maintain a fun, engaging, and safe environment
o Someone who values connection with children and understands the importance of building trust
 
REQUIREMENTS:
o Valid driver’s license
o Reliable transportation
o Must pass a background check
o Previous experience in caregiving, child care, or respite is preferred but not required
description_text:
IN YOUR HOME TEENAGE RESPITE PROVIDER – Eau Claire, WI
We are seeking a reliable, compassionate provider to support a bright, creative, animal-loving. This position is ideal for someone who values mentorship, meaningful connections, and helping a teen build confidence and independence. The individual you’ll be supporting is initially quiet and shy but becomes silly, fun, and engaging once she feels comfortable. She is socially younger than her age and thrives with routine, patience, and gentle encouragement. She also follows a strict gluten-free diet due to celiac disease, so providers must be respectful and mindful of her dietary needs and sensitivities.
ABOUT THE KIDDO:
o
LOVES animals (volunteers at the Kitty Cafe & Humane Society)
o
Roblox
o
Art & Being Creative – digital art
o
Board Games
o
Action City – (She has a pass & enjoys the Arcade & swimming at Chaos)
o
RESPITE WILL BE DONE
IN THE PROVIDERS HOME/COMMUNITY
SCHEDULE & HOURS:
o
15 hours per week, mostly on weekends
o
On-call and flexible scheduling options – you can collaborate with the family to create a schedule that works for everyone
o
Weekend coverage is a priority, but flexibility is appreciated for night support as opportunities arise
COMPENSATION:
o
$17.66 per hour
RESPONSIBILITIES:
As an In-Home Respite Provider, you’ll play an important role in the child’s morning routine and overall comfort. Responsibilities include:
o
Providing calm, compassionate care and supervision during the morning routine
o
Assisting with meals and giving verbal prompts for hydration
o
Engaging in fun activities the child enjoys
o
Creating a safe, structured, and positive environment where the child can feel supported and ready for the day ahead
IDEAL CANDIDATE:
We are looking for someone who is:
o
Friendly, reliable, and enthusiastic
o
Patient and understanding, especially when children are frustrated or energetic
o
Flexible and able to change gears quickly
o
Comfortable working in a home setting and occasionally in the community
o
Able to maintain a fun, engaging, and safe environment
o
Someone who values connection with children and understands the importance of building trust
REQUIREMENTS:
o
Valid driver’s license
o
Reliable transportation
o
Must pass a background check
o
Previous experience in caregiving, child care, or respite is preferred but not required

description_html:
A welcoming family in Brown Deer is seeking a full-time overnight caregiver to provide compassionate, in-home support for their adult son with special needs. This role is ideal for someone patient, dependable, and committed to creating a safe and supportive environment.

Pay: $20.00 per hour
Schedule
• Member is authorized for 24/7 in-home care
• Monday–Friday | 11:00 PM – 7:00 AM

Responsibilities
• Provide care in the member’s home
• Assist with transfers using a Hoyer lift
• Assist with G-tube feedings and suctioning
• Support with bathing, dressing, and toileting as needed
• Assist with medications when required
• Ensure safety, comfort, and companionship throughout the shift

Qualifications
• Valid driver’s license or reliable transportation to and from shifts
• Prior experience with feeding tubes and Hoyer lifts required
• Must be 18 years or older
• Ability to pass a criminal background check

Important Employment Note
If hired, your legal employer will be the Member or their Managing Party, not Consumer Direct Care Network (CDCN). CDCN supports recruitment only; all hiring and employment decisions are made by the family.

If you’re a dependable caregiver looking for a steady overnight position, apply today!

description_html:
A welcoming family in Madison is seeking a full-time, first-shift caregiver to provide in-home support for their adult son with Autism. This role is perfect for someone who is patient, dependable, and genuinely enjoys building meaningful connections.

Schedule & Pay
• 40 hours per week (flexible scheduling!)
• $18–$19 per hour
• Mileage reimbursement provided

Key Responsibilities
• Assist with personal care (brushing teeth/hair, showering, post-toileting support)
• Support and teach daily life skills
• Engage in games, arts & crafts, and fun activities
• Meal preparation and cooking for the family
• Laundry assistance and light housekeeping (dishes, general upkeep)
• Grocery shopping and running errands
• Maintain professionalism, respect boundaries, and stay attentive (no cell phone use during shifts)

Ideal Candidate
• Patient, respectful, reliable, and dependable
• Outgoing and fun personality is a big plus
• Experience working with individuals on the Autism spectrum preferred
• Client prefers older, experienced in-home caregivers
• Must remain awake and attentive throughout shift

Requirements
• Authorized to work in the U.S.
• Able to pass a criminal background check
• Valid driver’s license, auto insurance, and reliable vehicle

Important Employment Note
If hired, your legal employer will be the family member or their Managing Party, not Consumer Direct Care Network (CDCN). CDCN assists only with recruitment; all hiring and employment decisions are made by the family.

If this sounds like a great fit, apply now!

description_html:
Are you a compassionate, dedicated individual seeking a rewarding caregiving role?

We have an exciting opportunity for a full-time caregiver to join a loving Mom and Son duo in their Madison home. This position offers a competitive wage and a flexible 40-hour work week.

As a caregiver, you will play a vital role in enhancing this family's quality of life by assisting with a variety of tasks. Your responsibilities will include housekeeping, laundry, grocery shopping, running errands, and supporting personal hygiene needs. Additionally, you will help with meal preparation and cooking to ensure nutritious and delicious meals for the household. 

Requirements:
Valid Driver’s License, Insurance, and Reliable Transportation
No Cell Phone Use During Work Hours unless Emergent
Successfully Pass Background Check
Experienced in working with individuals with Mental Health/Autism
Fun Personality!

***No allergies to cats - the family has 3***

This role is perfect for someone who is empathetic, reliable, and eager to make a difference in the lives of others. If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, we would love to hear from you!

description_html:
We are seeking a compassionate and reliable Youth Respite Provider to offer support, companionship, and guidance to a youth in the Menomonie area. The right candidate will be active and engaging, have strong communication skills, be patient, and have experience working with individuals with Autism.

Pay: $14.13/hourly rate
Schedule: 10 hours per month- Every Other Weekend, but flexible!

Tasks:
• Ensure safety of client while under your supervision
• Provide motivation to be active, both at home and in the community
• Provide transportation to community outings
• Provide companionship and engage with the client in meaningful ways to encourage social connection
• Redirect behaviors as needed
Qualifications:
• Must have a valid Driver's License and reliable transportation
• Must have auto insurance
• Must pass background check
• Prior experience working with individuals with Autism a plus

description_html:
We are seeking a compassionate, dependable Respite Provider to offer supportive care for an adult client. The ideal candidate will help promote the client’s independence while maintaining a safe, structured, and positive environment during the primary caregiver’s absence.
 
Pay: $18.42/hour
 
Schedule
• Every Monday: 4:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
• Occasional weekends (if needed): to be agreed upon by family and caregiver
 
Responsibilities
• Provide respite care in the client’s home.
• Ensure the client’s safety and well-being at all times.
• Assist with basic money management (e.g., supporting budgeting and planning).
• Support the client in preparing simple meals and snacks.
• Offer timely medication reminders (no medication administration required).
• Provide transportation to and from community locations (e.g., errands, appointments, outings).
• Give verbal reminders to maintain a clean and organized environment.
• Engage with the client in respectful, meaningful ways to encourage social connection and independence.
 
Qualifications
• Valid Driver’s License and reliable transportation required.
• Auto insurance required.
• Must pass a background check.
• Prior experience working with individuals with disabilities preferred.
• Ability to follow care plans and communicate effectively with the family and care team.
 
If you are a caring professional who values building supportive relationships and promoting independence, we’d love to hear from you.

description_html:
We are searching for an experienced Child Respite Provider to support a creative, energetic young boy with special needs. The ideal candidate will be confident, energetic, and patient. This role requires your willingness to engage in positive activities with the boy to have meaningful interactions during respite time. You will also use your skills to guide and support the boy through various challenges, helping him make positive choices in a safe and encouraging environment.
 
This boy enjoys: Animals, bike riding, being outdoors, fishing, parks, video games (Roblox), trampoline park, and paper crafts (origami, paper airplanes)
 
Location: Green Bay, WI
Wage: $17.66/hour
Schedule: 8-10 hours per week - Saturdays and Sundays
 
Responsibilities:
Provide 1:1 mentoring, companionship, and supervision
Educate the boy on important life skills, decision-making processes and problem solving.
Foster a supportive relationship with open communication, respect, and trust.
Provide transportation from afterschool program to respite location.
 
Qualifications:
• Age 18 or older at start of employment
• Valid Driver’s license, reliable transportation, and auto insurance
• Experience working with children with special needs
• Willing to undergo a background check
description_text:
We are searching for an experienced
Child Respite Provider
to support a creative, energetic young boy with special needs. The ideal candidate will be confident, energetic, and patient. This role requires your willingness to engage in positive activities with the boy to have meaningful interactions during respite time. You will also use your skills to guide and support the boy through various challenges, helping him make positive choices in a safe and encouraging environment.
This boy enjoys: Animals, bike riding, being outdoors, fishing, parks, video games (Roblox), trampoline park, and paper crafts (origami, paper airplanes)
Location
: Green Bay, WI
Wage
: $17.66/hour
Schedule
: 8-10 hours per week - Saturdays and Sundays
Responsibilities:
Provide 1:1 mentoring, companionship, and supervision
Educate the boy on important life skills, decision-making processes and problem solving.
Foster a supportive relationship with open communication, respect, and trust.
Provide transportation from afterschool program to respite location.
Qualifications:
•
Age 18 or older at start of employment
•
Valid Driver’s license, reliable transportation, and auto insurance
•
Experience working with children with special needs
•
Willing to undergo a background check

description_html:
We're seeking a Compassionate and Reliable Caregiver to support an independent individual with her daily routine in a private home setting. This position offers a consistent 9 AM-3 PM shift (Monday - Sunday) and is shared with another care provider.
 
As a Caregiver, you will provide essential support and assistance to individuals in need, ensuring their well-being and comfort.
 
Duties:
• Transfers to and from bed and wheelchair
• Sponge or in-shower bathing
• Dressing and Grooming
• Assist with toileting
• Meal Preparation
• Assist with ROM (range of motion) exercises
• Light Housekeeping and Laundry
 
Skills:
• Compassion, Reliable, and Dependable Caregiver.
• Working with individuals with physical disabilities
• Ability to perform heavy lifting when necessary
• Excellent communication skills
• High degree of empathy and patience
 
Wage: $20 an hour
 
Schedule/Shifts:
• 9:00am- 3:00pm (daily)
• 44 hours a week
• Consistent Schedule (Monday - Sunday)
• Scheduled hours can be split with another provider
 
Requirements:
• Must have Valid Driver's license/vehicle insurance/reliable vehicle*
• Must pass a background check before hiring
• Must be authorized to work in the U.S.
• 1 Year of Experience within CNA, in-home care, adult care, or assisted living is preferred
• Females are encouraged to apply!

description_html:
Youth Respite Provider – Safety, Support & Emotional Regulation

We are seeking a caring Youth Respite Provider to support a vibrant young boy with autism in the Black River Falls area. This meaningful role focuses on one-on-one care that emphasizes emotional regulation and structured support.

The ideal candidate is patient, compassionate, and reliable, with a genuine passion for supporting neurodivergent youth. If you’re dependable and eager to make a positive impact on a child’s life, we’d love to hear from you!
 
Location: Black River Falls, WI
Compensation: $17.66/hour
Schedule: Saturdays, Noon–5 PM
 
Key Responsibilities
• Provide one-on-one, safety-focused care and supervision.
• Support emotional regulation with calm, consistent responses.
• Assist with personal care needs, including toileting, in a respectful and supportive way.
• Engage the child in supportive, age-appropriate activities.
• Communicate with the child using non-verbal communication styles

Ideal Candidate
• Calm, observant, and able to maintain a safe, structured setting.
• Experienced with children on the autism spectrum or with sensory needs.
• Comfortable supporting both active play and quiet moments for regulation.
• Skilled at de-escalation, redirection, and following care routines.
• Patient, compassionate, and adaptable to the child’s emotional and developmental needs.
• Strong communicator who values collaboration with the family.

Requirements
• Must pass a caregiver/criminal background check.
• Authorized to work in the U.S.
• Reliable transportation and strong attendance record.
• Experience with non-verbal communication methods preferred, but not required.

Why This Role Matters
Make a real difference by helping a child feel safe, supported, and seen.
Join this family as a steady, caring presence in their child’s life and positively impact his daily experiences.

description_html:
We are seeking a kind, patient, and dependable Child Respite Provider to spend quality time with a pre-teen girl with autism and other special needs. This role offers a meaningful opportunity to build a positive, trusting relationship while supporting her growth in independence and self-confidence. Respite care will take place in the provider’s home and within the community.

If you are caring, trustworthy, and passionate about making a real difference in a child’s life, we would love to hear from you.

This girl enjoys: arts & crafts, creative writing, video games, and fantasy (dragons)

Location: Black River Falls, WI
Wage: $14.13 per hour
Schedule: Up to 12 hours per month – Weekday late afternoons and potential weekend hours

Responsibilities:
• Provide compassionate and consistent care during respite hours
• Engage in fun, age-appropriate activities and outings
• Serve as a positive role model and mentor
• Maintain a safe, respectful, and nurturing environment
• Use redirection techniques, if necessary, with patience and calm demeanor

Requirements:
• Valid Driver’s License, reliable vehicle, and auto insurance
• Experience working with special needs children, autism, and mental health conditions
• Age 18 or older at the start of employment
• Willing to undergo a background check prior to hire

description_html:
We are looking for a kind, patient, and dependable Child Respite Provider to care for two young brothers with special needs. Care will take place in the provider’s home and/or in the community.  The ideal provider is compassionate, reliable, and comfortable working with children who need support with activities, routines, and encouragement for positive behavior. This is a rewarding opportunity to support two great kids and help their family.

These boys enjoy watching cartoons, playing with toy trucks and cars, blocks, dinosaur toys and being outdoors.

Location:  Fall Creek, WI (Eau Claire County)
Wage: $17.70 per hour
Schedule: 5 hours per week – Prefers Saturdays or Sundays 1pm to 6pm

Responsibilities: 
  • Supervision/Companionship
  • Cares: Toileting (assistance wiping/pull up change/clothing adjustment if necessary) Meal Prep
  • Redirect and deescalate behaviors appropriately as needed with a calm manner/positive attitude
  • Outings with both boys in their community for activities

Qualifications: 
  • 5 years of previous experience with special needs children/Autism preferred
  • Valid Driver’s License, reliable vehicle, and auto insurance REQUIRED. 
  • Provide a safe, engaging environment to provide respite services in your home. 
  • The family prefers providers to have HS Diploma/GED and be at least 21 years of age or older.

description_html:
We are seeking an experienced, kind, and reliable Child Respite Provider to support a young boy with epilepsy, speech delay, and other developmental delays. Respite care will take place in the family’s home only, as the child is considered an elopement risk when distracted or overstimulated in certain environments.

The ideal candidate is patient, active, and engaging, with a thoughtful and gentle communication style. You should be attentive, safety-minded, and comfortable supporting a child with special needs while encouraging play, connection, and emotional regulation.

This boy likes Legos, arts & crafts, playgrounds, tv shows (Ben 10, SpongeBob, Minions), and making new friends.

Location: Eau Claire, WI
Wage: $14.13 per hour
Schedule: 5 hours per week – Saturdays & Sundays

Responsibilities: companionship/supervision, meal prep, play/engage in activities, redirect as needed.

Requirements: 
• Prior experience providing childcare/respite with special needs children
• Valid driver’s license, reliable transportation, and auto insurance
• Willing to undergo a caregiver background check prior to hire
• Family prefers FEMALE providers

description_html:
We are seeking a kind, experienced Specialized Childcare Provider to care for a male toddler with special healthcare needs in his home. Tasks include supporting daily routines, including G-tube feedings, hygiene, play, rest, and age-appropriate activities. This role requires consistency, compassion, and a positive approach to caregiving as you provide attentive, one-on-one care tailored to the child’s specific needs.

The ideal provider will be patient and committed to providing safe, nurturing, and developmentally supportive care.

This little boy enjoys toys, toy cars and trucks, the movie Cars, being outside, the sandbox, walks, trips to the library, and reading books.

Location: Menomonee Falls, WI
Wage: Up to $25 per hour – based on experience
Schedule: Up to 35 hours per week
                        8:30am to 4:30pm: Mondays/Thursdays/Fridays

Responsibilities:
• Provide attentive, nurturing care in a safe and supportive home environment
• Perform G-tube feedings/medication administration with confidence and precision.
• Other cares may include bathing, dressing, diaper changes/toilet training, and perform household duties relation to the care you provide, i.e. cleaning up after meals, doing dishes and cleaning up after activities.  
• Engage the child in age-appropriate activities/play that support comfort and development
• Communicate clearly and effectively with parents and care team members

Qualifications:
• Age 18 or older at start of employment
• 1st Aide/CPR certification preferred
• C.N.A. certification with GTUBE experience preferred, but willing to train/refresh training for someone with prior G-Tube experience
• FEMALE PROVIDERS PREFERRED BY FAMILY
• MUST HAVE Valid Driver’s License, reliable transportation, and auto insurance
• Willing to undergo a background check prior to hire

description_html:
We are looking for a kind, patient Child Respite Provider to care for a young non-verbal girl with autism in Wausau.  Care will take place both in the community and in your home. The ideal provider enjoys working with children, has experience with autism or special needs, and has a calm, positive attitude. Most important is someone who can connect with her, have fun, and help keep her safe and happy.

This little girl enjoys outdoor activities, nature exploration, arts and crafts, visits to parks and museums, educational activities, and using her tablet.

Location: Wausau, WI
Pay: $14.13 per hourl

Schedule:
• 20 hours/week 
• Monday-Friday - 4:30PM-6:30PM
• Saturday - 12:00PM-4:00PM 
• Days off from school
   
Tasks:
• Supervision 
• Toileting assistance 
• Active attentiveness 
• Communication Assistance 
• Companionship and Social Engagement 
• Provide transportation to/from activities 
• Engage with client and encourage age-appropriate behaviors. 
  
Qualifications:
• Authorized to work in the U.S. 
• Criminal/Caregiver background check. 
• Compassionate individual with experience working with special needs children.
• Valid driver's license, reliable transportation, and auto insurance required. 
• Understanding of Autism and development disabilities. 
• FEMALE providers preferred by family

description_html:
We are looking for a caring, reliable, and experienced Child Respite Provider to spend time with young twin boys with autism and limited speech. Your presence will help them feel safe, happy, and engaged as you build a trusting, positive relationship while supporting them with their routine, play, and learning in fun and meaningful ways.

The ideal candidate will be patient, dependable, and confident in working with children with special needs.

The boys enjoy: pretend play, games, playing outside, power wheels, and videos on the tablet. 

Location: Eau Claire, WI 
Wage: $17.70 per hour/$259.32 per day (shifts over 8 hours)

Hours: Possible schedule scenarios below to be agreed upon/developed by family and provider.
• Up to 5 hours per week - Saturdays from 1pm to 4pm. 
• 1-2 Days per month – Saturdays – (shifts over 8 hours with potential for overnights)

Duties:
• Supervision: always be attentive to both boys 
• Personal Cares: bathing assistance, toileting/diaper changes/toilet training
• Meal Prep/snacks
• Community outings/public events
• Redirect behaviors appropriately 

Qualifications: 
• Previous experience working with children with special needs, including those on the Autism Spectrum.
• Confidence in your abilities and skills to provide exceptional, compassionate care.
• Demonstrates appropriate, positive behavior and able to maintain healthy professional boundaries.
• Valid driver’s license, reliable transportation, and current auto insurance.
• Willingness to commit to be a long-term provider 
• Family prefers FEMALE non-smokers.

description_html:
Calling All Kind Humans & Weekend Heroes!
Respite Provider Needed – Chippewa Falls, WI

Do you like Disney music, building cool things, and being active outdoors? 
Are you patient, upbeat, and good at meeting kids where they’re at?
Then this might be the perfect part-time gig for you!

We’re looking for a Respite Provider for a sweet, creative, and energetic young boy in Chippewa Falls. He’s on the Autism spectrum (no experience required — just an open heart and willingness to learn).

About This Awesome Kid:
• Mainly nonverbal, but communicates in his own ways (and sometimes with words!)
• Loves drawing and building (especially buildings & airplanes )
• Big fan of Disney movies — Cars is a favorite 
• Enjoys climbing, swimming, and playing outside
• Has access to the YMCA & Chippewa Falls Pool

Schedule & Pay:
• 4 hours/week
• Saturday & Sunday afternoons preferred (flexible!)
• $14.13/hour (after-tax rate)

Location: Chippewa Falls, WI
(Care location decided together with family)

What You’ll Do:
• Build trust through patience, kindness, and communication
• Keep him engaged with fun, active, and creative activities
• Encourage his love for art, building, and movement
• Provide gentle hourly restroom reminders

You’d Be a Great Fit If You Are:
• Kind, patient, and energetic
• Comfortable being active and outdoors
• Open to communication with the family
• Flexible and adaptable
• Experience with Autism is a plus — but not required!

Requirements:
• Valid driver’s license & reliable transportation
• Willing to complete a caregiver background check

This is a rewarding, low-hour opportunity to make a real difference in a child’s life — while having fun doing it.

If you’re interested or want to learn more, reach out today!
